	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" >Lionel Messi</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">

		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">"Messi" redirects here. For other uses, see <a href="/wiki/Messi_(disambiguation)" class="mw-disambig" title="Messi (disambiguation)">Messi (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">


</p>
<div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Argentine footballer</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>

<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;"><a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_under-20_football_team" title="Argentina national under-20 football team">U-20 Team</a>
</td></tr>
<tr>

<td style="text-align:center;vertical-align:middle;"><img alt="Third place" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/16px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png" decoding="async" title="Third place" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/24px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/89/Bronze_medal_icon.svg/32px-Bronze_medal_icon.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="16" data-file-height="16" /></td>

.sidebar-list-title{text-align:left;font-weight:bold;line-height:1.6em;font-size:105%}@media(max-width:720px){body.mediawiki .mw-parser-output .sidebar{width:100%!important;clear:both;float:none!important;margin-left:0!important;margin-right:0!important}}</style><table class="sidebar nomobile vcard hlist" style="border: 4px double #87CEEB;"><tbody><tr><th class="sidebar-title" style="font-size: 90%; padding: 0; line-height: 150%;"><table><tbody><tr>
<td style="background: #9acdff; vertical-align:middle; padding:5px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_20180626_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="Lionel Messi" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg/90px-Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="90" height="135" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg/135px-Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg/180px-Lionel_Messi_20180626_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="769" /></a></td>
<td style="background: #9acdff; vertical-align:middle; padding:6px; width:100%;"><span style="font-size:0.8em;"><span style="color:#000000">This article is part of a series about</span></span><br /><span class="vcard"><span class="fn"><span style="font-size:1.45em;"><a class="mw-selflink selflink"><span style="color:#000000">Lionel Messi</span></a></span></span></span></td>
</tr></tbody></table></th></tr><tr><td class="sidebar-content" style="padding:0.3em;">
<p><b><a href="/wiki/Argentines" title="Argentines"><span style="color:#000">Argentine</span></a> <a href="/wiki/Football_player" title="Football player"><span style="color:#000">professional footballer</span></a></b><br />
</p>

</tr><tr><td class="sidebar-navbar" style="text-align:center;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r992953826">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}.mw-parser-output .infobox .navbar{font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .navbox .navbar{display:block;font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .navbox-title .navbar{float:left;text-align:left;margin-right:0.5em}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Lionel_Messi_series" title="Template:Lionel Messi series"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Lionel_Messi_series" title="Template talk:Lionel Messi series"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Lionel_Messi_series&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Lionel Andrés Messi</b><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">&#91;note 1&#93;</a></sup> (<small>Spanish pronunciation:&#160;</small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">[ljonel andes mesi]</a></span>&#32;<span class="nowrap" style="font-size:85%">(<span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap;margin-right:.25em;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="About this sound" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" decoding="async" width="11" height="11" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20" /></a></span><a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/09/Lionel_Andr%C3%A9s_Messi_-_Name.ogg" class="internal" title="Lionel Andrés Messi - Name.ogg">listen</a></span></span>)</span>;<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;A&#93;</a></sup> born 24 June 1987) is an Argentine professional <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> and <a href="/wiki/Captain_(association_football)" title="Captain (association football)">captains</a> both the Spanish club <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina national team</a>. Often considered as the best player in the world and widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, Messi has won a record six <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> awards,<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;note 2&#93;</a></sup> a record six <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a>, and in 2020 was named to the <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or_Dream_Team" title="Ballon d&#39;Or Dream Team">Ballon d'Or Dream Team</a>. He has spent <a href="/wiki/List_of_one-club_men_in_association_football" title="List of one-club men in association football">his entire professional career</a> with Barcelona, where he has won a <a href="/wiki/List_of_FC_Barcelona_records_and_statistics" title="List of FC Barcelona records and statistics">club-record</a> 33 trophies, including ten <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> titles, six <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> titles and four <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions Leagues</a>. A prolific goalscorer and creative playmaker, Messi holds the records for <a href="/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_top_scorers#All-time_top_scorers" title="List of La Liga top scorers">most goals in La Liga</a> (465), <a href="/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_top_scorers#Top_scorers_by_season" title="List of La Liga top scorers">a La Liga</a> and European league season (50), <a href="/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_hat-tricks" title="List of La Liga hat-tricks">most hat-tricks in La Liga</a> (36) and the <a href="/wiki/List_of_UEFA_Champions_League_hat-tricks" title="List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks">UEFA Champions League</a> (8), and most <a href="/wiki/Assist_(association_football)" title="Assist (association football)">assists</a> in La Liga (190), a <a href="/wiki/List_of_La_Liga_top_scorers#Top_scorers_by_season" title="List of La Liga top scorers">La Liga</a> and European league season (21)<sup id="cite_ref-13" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-13">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="Copa América">Copa América</a> (12). He has scored over <a href="/wiki/List_of_footballers_with_500_or_more_goals" title="List of footballers with 500 or more goals">750 senior career goals</a> for club and country, and has the most goals ever by a player for a single club.
</p><p>Born and raised in central Argentina, Messi relocated to Spain to join Barcelona at age 13, for whom he made his competitive debut aged 17 in October 2004. He established himself as an integral player for the club within the next three years, and in his first uninterrupted season in <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2008–09 FC Barcelona season">2008–09</a> he helped Barcelona achieve the first <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> in Spanish football; that year, aged 22, Messi won his first <a href="/wiki/2009_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2009 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>. Three successful seasons followed, with Messi winning four consecutive Ballons d'Or, making him the first player to win the award four times and in a row.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup> During the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2011–12 FC Barcelona season">2011–12 season</a>, he set the La Liga and European records for most goals scored in a single season, while establishing himself as <a href="/wiki/List_of_FC_Barcelona_records_and_statistics#Top_goalscorers" title="List of FC Barcelona records and statistics">Barcelona's all-time top scorer</a>. The following two seasons, Messi finished second for the <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> behind <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> (his perceived <a href="/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">career rival</a>), before regaining his best form during the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2014–15 FC Barcelona season">2014–15 campaign</a>, becoming the all-time top scorer in La Liga and leading Barcelona to a historic second treble, after which he was awarded a fifth Ballon d'Or in <a href="/wiki/2015_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2015 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2015</a>. Messi assumed the captaincy of Barcelona in 2018, and in 2019 he secured a record <a href="/wiki/2019_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2019 Ballon d&#39;Or">sixth Ballon d'Or</a>.
</p><p>An Argentine international, Messi is his country's <a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Argentina national football team">all-time leading goalscorer</a>. At youth level, he won the <a href="/wiki/2005_FIFA_World_Youth_Championship" title="2005 FIFA World Youth Championship">2005 FIFA World Youth Championship</a>, finishing the tournament with both the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_U-20_World_Cup#Awards" title="FIFA U-20 World Cup">Golden Ball and Golden Shoe</a>, and an <a href="/wiki/Olympic_medal" title="Olympic medal">Olympic gold medal</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a>. His style of play as a diminutive, left-footed <a href="/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbler</a> drew comparisons with his compatriot <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who described Messi as his <a href="/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">successor</a>. After his senior debut in August 2005, Messi became the youngest Argentine to play and score in a <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> during the <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 edition</a>, and reached the final of the <a href="/wiki/2007_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2007 Copa América">2007 Copa América</a>, where he was named young player of the tournament. As the squad's captain from August 2011, he led Argentina to three consecutive finals: the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>, for which he won the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" title="FIFA World Cup awards">Golden Ball</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015</a> and <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">2016 Copa América</a>. After announcing his international retirement in 2016, he reversed his decision and led his country to qualification for the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>, and a third-place finish at the <a href="/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a>.
</p><p>One of the most famous athletes in the world, Messi has been sponsored by sportswear company <a href="/wiki/Adidas" title="Adidas">Adidas</a> since 2006 and has established himself as their leading brand endorser. According to <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i>, he was the world's highest-paid footballer for five years out of six between 2009 and 2014, and was ranked the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's highest-paid athlete</a> by <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> in 2019. Messi was among <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100"><i>Time</i></a>'s <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a> in 2011 and 2012. In February 2020, he was awarded the <a href="/wiki/Laureus_World_Sports_Award_for_Sportsman_of_the_Year" title="Laureus World Sports Award for Sportsman of the Year">Laureus World Sportsman of the Year</a>, thus becoming the first footballer and also the first team sport athlete to win the award. Later that year, Messi became the second footballer (and second team-sport athlete) to surpass $1 billion in career earnings.<sup id="cite_ref-Career_billion_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Career_billion-15">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-4"><div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-17"><a href="#International_career"><span class="tocnumber">3</span> <span class="toctext">International career</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-18"><a href="#2004–05:_Success_at_youth_level"><span class="tocnumber">3.1</span> <span class="toctext">2004–05: Success at youth level</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-19"><a href="#2005–06:_Senior_and_World_Cup_debuts"><span class="tocnumber">3.2</span> <span class="toctext">2005–06: Senior and World Cup debuts</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-20"><a href="#2007–08:_Copa_América_final_and_Olympic_gold"><span class="tocnumber">3.3</span> <span class="toctext">2007–08: Copa América final and Olympic gold</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-21"><a href="#2008–11:_Collective_decline"><span class="tocnumber">3.4</span> <span class="toctext">2008–11: Collective decline</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-22"><a href="#2011–13:_Assuming_the_captaincy"><span class="tocnumber">3.5</span> <span class="toctext">2011–13: Assuming the captaincy</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-23"><a href="#2014–15:_World_Cup_and_Copa_América_finals"><span class="tocnumber">3.6</span> <span class="toctext">2014–15: World Cup and Copa América finals</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-24"><a href="#2016–17:_Third_Copa_América_final,_retirement,_and_return"><span class="tocnumber">3.7</span> <span class="toctext">2016–17: Third Copa América final, retirement, and return</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-25"><a href="#&quot;Don&#39;t_go,_Leo&quot;"><span class="tocnumber">3.7.1</span> <span class="toctext">"Don't go, Leo"</span></a></li>

</ul>
</li>

</ul>
</div>
</div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life">Early life</span></h2>
<p>Messi was born on 24 June 1987 in <a href="/wiki/Rosario,_Santa_Fe" title="Rosario, Santa Fe">Rosario</a>, the third of four children of Jorge Messi, a steel factory manager, and his wife Celia Cuccittini, who worked in a magnet manufacturing workshop. On his father's side, he is of <a href="/wiki/Italian_Argentines" title="Italian Argentines">Italian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Argentines" title="Spanish Argentines">Spanish</a> descent, the great-grandson of immigrants from the northcentral <a href="/wiki/Adriatic_Sea" title="Adriatic Sea">Adriatic</a> <a href="/wiki/Marche" title="Marche">Marche</a> region of <a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy">Italy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Catalonia" title="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, and on his mother's side, he has primarily Italian ancestry.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201332–37_5-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué201332–37-5">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> Growing up in a tight-knit, football-loving family, "Leo" developed a passion for the sport from an early age, playing constantly with his older brothers, Rodrigo and Matías, and his cousins, <a href="/wiki/Maxi_Biancucchi" title="Maxi Biancucchi">Maximiliano</a> and <a href="/wiki/Emanuel_Biancucchi" title="Emanuel Biancucchi">Emanuel Biancucchi</a>, both of whom became professional footballers.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli20129–10_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli20129–10-17">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> At the age of four he joined local club Grandoli, where he was coached by his father, though his earliest influence as a player came from his maternal grandmother, Celia, who accompanied him to training and matches.<sup id="cite_ref-Magic_in_His_Feet_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Magic_in_His_Feet-18">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup> He was greatly affected by her death, shortly before his eleventh birthday; since then, as a devout Catholic, he has celebrated his goals by looking up and pointing to the sky in tribute to his grandmother.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201344–45_19-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué201344–45-19">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:25%; ;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1012376600">.mw-parser-output .quotebox{background-color:#F9F9F9;border:1px solid #aaa;box-sizing:border-box;padding:10px;font-size:88%;max-width:100%}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft{margin:0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright{margin:0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.centered{margin:0.5em auto 0.8em auto}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft p,.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright p{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-title{background-color:#F9F9F9;text-align:center;font-size:larger;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:before{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" “ ";vertical-align:-45%;line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:after{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" ” ";line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .left-aligned{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .right-aligned{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .center-aligned{text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .quotebox cite{display:block;font-style:normal}@media screen and (max-width:640px){.mw-parser-output .quotebox{width:100%!important;margin:0 0 0.8em!important;float:none!important}}</style>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"When you saw him you would think: this kid can't play ball. He's a dwarf, he's too fragile, too small. But immediately you'd realise that he was born different, that he was a phenomenon and that he was going to be something impressive."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="/wiki/Newell%27s_Old_Boys" title="Newell&#39;s Old Boys">Newell's Old Boys</a> youth coach <a href="/wiki/Adri%C3%A1n_Coria" title="Adrián Coria">Adrián Coria</a> shares his first impression of the 12-year-old Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201238_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201238-21">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>A lifelong supporter of <a href="/wiki/Newell%27s_Old_Boys" title="Newell&#39;s Old Boys">Newell's Old Boys</a>, Messi joined the Rosario club when he was six years old. During the six years he played for Newell's, he scored almost 500 goals as a member of "The Machine of '87", the near-unbeatable youth side named for the year of their birth, and regularly entertained crowds by performing ball tricks during half-time of the first team's home games.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201231–35_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201231–35-23">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup> However, his future as a professional player was threatened when, at age 10, he was diagnosed with a <a href="/wiki/Growth_hormone_deficiency" title="Growth hormone deficiency">growth hormone deficiency</a>. As his father's health insurance covered only two years of <a href="/wiki/Growth_hormone_treatment" class="mw-redirect" title="Growth hormone treatment">growth hormone treatment</a>, which cost at least <a href="/wiki/Argentine_peso" title="Argentine peso">$</a>1,000 per month, Newell's agreed to contribute, but later reneged on their promise.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Legend_of_El_Enano_24-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Legend_of_El_Enano-24">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup> He was scouted by Buenos Aires club <a href="/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a>, whose <a href="/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmaker</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pablo_Aimar" title="Pablo Aimar">Pablo Aimar</a>, he idolised, but they were also unable to pay for his treatment due to <a href="/wiki/1998%E2%80%932002_Argentine_great_depression" title="1998–2002 Argentine great depression">Argentina's economic collapse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-On_a_Mission_25-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-On_a_Mission-25">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Pablo_Aimar:_The_Argentinian_Wizard_Admired_by_Maradona_and_Messi_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pablo_Aimar:_The_Argentinian_Wizard_Admired_by_Maradona_and_Messi-26">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup> His goalscoring idol growing up was <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>, with Messi calling him "the best forward I've ever seen".<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:La_Masia_(Can_Planas)_(Barcelona)_-_1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg/220px-La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg/330px-La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg/440px-La_Masia_%28Can_Planas%29_%28Barcelona%29_-_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3008" data-file-height="2000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:La_Masia_(Can_Planas)_(Barcelona)_-_1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi enrolled at Barcelona's youth academy, <a href="/wiki/La_Masia" title="La Masia">La Masia</a>, at age 13</div></div></div>
<p>As the Messi family had relatives in Catalonia, they sought to arrange a trial with <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in September 2000. First team director <a href="/wiki/Carles_Rexach" title="Carles Rexach">Charly Rexach</a> immediately wanted to sign him, but the board of directors hesitated; at the time it was highly unusual for European clubs to sign foreign players of such a young age. On 14 December, an ultimatum was issued for Barcelona to prove their commitment, and Rexach, with no other paper at hand, offered a contract on a paper napkin.<sup id="cite_ref-On_a_Mission_25-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-On_a_Mission-25">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette-28">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> In February 2001, the family relocated to Barcelona, where they moved into an apartment near the club's stadium, <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>. During his first year in Spain, Messi rarely played with the <i>Infantiles</i> due to a transfer conflict with Newell's; as a foreigner, he could only be fielded in friendlies and the Catalan league. Without football, he struggled to integrate into the team; already reserved by nature, he was so quiet that his teammates initially believed he was mute. At home, he suffered from homesickness after his mother moved back to Rosario with his brothers and little sister, María Sol, while he stayed in Barcelona with his father.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette_28-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette-28">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Boy_Genius_29-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Boy_Genius-29">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After a year at Barcelona's youth academy, <a href="/wiki/La_Masia" title="La Masia">La Masia</a>, Messi was finally enrolled in the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Spanish_Football_Federation" title="Royal Spanish Football Federation">Royal Spanish Football Federation</a> (RFEF) in February 2002. Now playing in all competitions, he befriended his teammates, among whom were <a href="/wiki/Cesc_F%C3%A0bregas" title="Cesc Fàbregas">Cesc Fàbregas</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gerard_Piqu%C3%A9" title="Gerard Piqué">Gerard Piqué</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62-30">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup> After completing his growth hormone treatment aged 14,<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013149_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013149-31">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup> Messi became an integral part of the "Baby Dream Team", Barcelona's greatest-ever youth side. During his first full season (2002–03), he was top scorer with 36 goals in 30 games for the <i>Cadetes</i> A, who won an unprecedented treble of the league and both the Spanish and Catalan cups.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62_30-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201261–62-30">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Class_of_2002_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Class_of_2002-32">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup> The Copa Catalunya final, a 4–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/RCD_Espanyol" title="RCD Espanyol">Espanyol</a>, became known in club lore as the <i>partido de la máscara</i>, the final of the mask. A week after suffering a broken cheekbone during a league match, Messi was allowed to start the game on the condition that he wear a plastic protector; soon hindered by the mask, he took it off and scored two goals in 10 minutes before his substitution.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201244–45_33-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201244–45-33">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup> At the close of the season, he received an offer to join <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>, his first from a foreign club, but while Fàbregas and Piqué soon left for England, he chose to remain in Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette_28-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette-28">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-The_New_Messiah_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_New_Messiah-35">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_career">Club career</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Barcelona">Barcelona</span></h3>
<h4><span id="2003.E2.80.9305:_Rise_to_the_first_team"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2003–05:_Rise_to_the_first_team">2003–05: Rise to the first team</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"It seemed as if he had been playing with us all his life."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Barcelona's then assistant coach <a href="/wiki/Henk_Ten_Cate" class="mw-redirect" title="Henk Ten Cate">Henk Ten Cate</a> on Messi's first-team debut.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>During the <a href="/wiki/2003%E2%80%9304_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2003–04 FC Barcelona season">2003–04 season</a>, his fourth with Barcelona, Messi rapidly progressed through the club's ranks, debuting for a record five youth teams in a single campaign.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> After being named player of the tournament in four international pre-season competitions with the <i>Juveniles</i> B, he played only one official match with the team before being promoted to the <i><a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona_(youth)#Juvenil_A" title="FC Barcelona (youth)">Juveniles A</a></i>, where he scored 18 goals in 11 league games.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_38-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71-38">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup> Messi was then one of several youth players called up to strengthen a depleted first team during the international break. French winger <a href="/wiki/Ludovic_Giuly" title="Ludovic Giuly">Ludovic Giuly</a> explained how a teenage Leo caught the eye in a training session with <a href="/wiki/Frank_Rijkaard" title="Frank Rijkaard">Frank Rijkaard</a>'s first team: "He destroyed us all... They were kicking him all over the place to avoid being ridiculed by this kid, he just got up and kept on playing. He would dribble past four players and score a goal. Even the team's starting centre-backs were nervous. He was an alien."<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>At 16 years, four months, and 23 days old, Messi made his first team debut when he came on in the 75th minute during a friendly against <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Mourinho" title="José Mourinho">José Mourinho</a>'s <a href="/wiki/FC_Porto" title="FC Porto">Porto</a> on 16 November 2003.<sup id="cite_ref-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette_28-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette-28">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup> His performance, creating two chances and a shot on goal, impressed the technical staff, and he subsequently began training daily with the club's reserve side, <a href="/wiki/Barcelona_B" class="mw-redirect" title="Barcelona B">Barcelona B</a>, as well as weekly with the first team.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013191–193_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013191–193-42">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup> After his first training session with the senior squad, Barça's new star player, <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>, told his teammates that he believed the 16-year-old would become an even better player than himself.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249-43">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldinho soon befriended Messi, whom he called "little brother", which greatly eased his transition into the first team.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201253_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201253-44">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-The_Last_Jump_of_the_&#39;Flea&#39;_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Last_Jump_of_the_&#39;Flea&#39;-45">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg/170px-Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="242" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg/255px-Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/26/Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg/340px-Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1100" data-file-height="1567" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Leo_messi_barce_2005.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi playing against <a href="/wiki/M%C3%A1laga_CF" title="Málaga CF">Málaga</a> in October 2005</div></div></div>
<p>To gain further match experience, Messi joined <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona_C" title="FC Barcelona C">Barcelona C</a> in addition to the <i>Juveniles</i> A, playing his first game for the third team on 29 November. He helped save them from the relegation zone of the <a href="/wiki/Tercera_Divisi%C3%B3n" title="Tercera División">Tercera División</a>, scoring five goals in ten games, including a hat-trick in eight minutes during a <a href="/wiki/2003%E2%80%9304_Copa_del_Rey" title="2003–04 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> match while man-marked by <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Sergio_Ramos" title="Sergio Ramos">Sergio Ramos</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_38-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71-38">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185_46-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185-46">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup> His progress was reflected in his first professional contract, signed on 4 February 2004, which lasted until 2012 and contained an initial <a href="/wiki/Buyout_clause" title="Buyout clause">buyout clause</a> of €30&#160;million. A month later, on 6 March, he made his debut for Barcelona B in the <a href="/wiki/Segunda_Divisi%C3%B3n_B" title="Segunda División B">Segunda División B</a>, and his buyout clause automatically increased to €80&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_38-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71-38">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263-47">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> He played five games with the B team that season but did not score.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2003–04_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2003–04-48">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup> Physically he was weaker than his opponents, who were often much older and taller, and in training he worked on increasing his muscle mass and overall strength in order to be able to shake off defenders. Towards the end of the season, he returned to both youth teams, helping the <i>Juveniles</i> B win the league. He finished the campaign having scored for four of his five teams with a total of 36 goals in all official competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71_38-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201268–71-38">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185_46-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013183–185-46">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the <a href="/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2004–05 FC Barcelona season">2004–05 season</a>, Messi was a guaranteed starter for the B team, playing 17 games throughout the campaign and scoring on six occasions.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249_43-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249-43">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2004–05_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2004–05-49">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup> Since his debut the previous November, he had not been called up to the first team again, but in October 2004, the senior players asked manager Frank Rijkaard to promote him.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249_43-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013246–249-43">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> Since Ronaldinho already played on the left wing, Rijkaard moved Messi from his usual position onto the right flank (though initially against the player's wishes), allowing him to cut into the centre of the pitch and shoot with his dominant left foot.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201235–36_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201235–36-50">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)_51-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)-51">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> Messi made his league debut during the next match on 16 October, against <a href="/wiki/RCD_Espanyol" title="RCD Espanyol">Espanyol</a>, coming on in the 82nd minute.<sup id="cite_ref-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette_28-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-How_Argentinian_Teenager_Signed_for_Barcelona_on_a_Serviette-28">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup> At 17 years, three months, and 22 days old, he was at the time the youngest player to represent Barcelona in an official competition.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Last_Jump_of_the_&#39;Flea&#39;_45-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Last_Jump_of_the_&#39;Flea&#39;-45">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup> As a substitute player, he played 77 minutes in nine matches for the first team that season, including his debut in the <a href="/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2004–05 UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> against <a href="/wiki/FC_Shakhtar_Donetsk" title="FC Shakhtar Donetsk">Shakhtar Donetsk</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2004–05_49-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2004–05-49">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup> He scored his first senior goal on 1 May 2005, against <a href="/wiki/Albacete_Balompi%C3%A9" title="Albacete Balompié">Albacete</a>, from an assist by Ronaldinho, becoming – at that time – the youngest-ever scorer for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201235–36_50-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201235–36-50">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-All_the_Qualities_to_Take_World_by_Storm_53-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-All_the_Qualities_to_Take_World_by_Storm-53">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona, in their second season under Rijkaard, <a href="/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_La_Liga" title="2004–05 La Liga">won the league</a> for the first time in six years.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi,_Iniesta_and_Xavi_Driven_to_Join_the_Champions_League_Elite_54-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi,_Iniesta_and_Xavi_Driven_to_Join_the_Champions_League_Elite-54">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2005.E2.80.9308:_Becoming_a_starting_eleven_player"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2005–08:_Becoming_a_starting_eleven_player">2005–08: Becoming a starting eleven player</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:33%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"In my entire life I have never seen a player of such quality and personality at such a young age, particularly wearing the 'heavy' shirt of one of the world's great clubs."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="/wiki/Fabio_Capello" title="Fabio Capello">Fabio Capello</a> praises the 18-year-old Messi following the <a href="/wiki/Joan_Gamper_trophy" class="mw-redirect" title="Joan Gamper trophy">Joan Gamper trophy</a> in August 2005.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012264–265_55-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012264–265-55">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>On 24 June 2005, his 18th birthday, Messi signed his first contract as a senior team player. It made him a Barcelona player until 2010, two years less than his previous contract, but his buyout clause increased to €150&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263_47-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263-47">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> His breakthrough came two months later, on 24 August, during the <a href="/wiki/Joan_Gamper_Trophy" title="Joan Gamper Trophy">Joan Gamper Trophy</a>, Barcelona's pre-season competition. A starter for the first time, he gave a well-received performance against <a href="/wiki/Fabio_Capello" title="Fabio Capello">Fabio Capello</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a>, receiving an ovation from the <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012264–265_55-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012264–265-55">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup> While Capello requested to loan Messi, a bid to buy him came from <a href="/wiki/Inter_Milan" title="Inter Milan">Inter Milan</a>, who were willing to pay his €150&#160;million buyout clause and triple his wages.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">&#91;52&#93;</a></sup> According to then-president <a href="/wiki/Joan_Laporta" title="Joan Laporta">Joan Laporta</a>, it was the only time the club faced a real risk of losing Messi, but he ultimately decided to stay.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013272–276_57-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013272–276-57">&#91;53&#93;</a></sup> On 16 September, his contract was updated for the second time in three months and extended to 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263_47-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013262–263-47">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Starlet_Messi_Stays_at_Barça_until_2014_58-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Starlet_Messi_Stays_at_Barça_until_2014-58">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg/220px-Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg/330px-Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg 2x" data-file-width="360" data-file-height="270" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_Barca_training.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi during a training session with Barcelona in August 2006</div></div></div>
<p>Due to issues regarding his legal status in the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Spanish_Football_Federation" title="Royal Spanish Football Federation">Royal Spanish Football Federation</a>, Messi missed the start of <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_La_Liga" title="2005–06 La Liga">La Liga</a>, but on 26 September, he acquired <a href="/wiki/Spanish_nationality_law" title="Spanish nationality law">Spanish citizenship</a> and became eligible to play.<sup id="cite_ref-Starlet_Messi_Stays_at_Barça_until_2014_58-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Starlet_Messi_Stays_at_Barça_until_2014-58">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201291_59-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201291-59">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup> Wearing the number 19 shirt, he gradually established himself as the first-choice right winger, forming an attacking trio with Ronaldinho and striker <a href="/wiki/Samuel_Eto%27o" title="Samuel Eto&#39;o">Samuel Eto'o</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-The_New_Messiah_35-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_New_Messiah-35">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269_60-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269-60">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Has_Ronaldinho&#39;s_Number_61-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Has_Ronaldinho&#39;s_Number-61">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup> He was in the starting line-up in major matches like his first <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">Clásico</a></i> against rivals <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_CF" title="Real Madrid CF">Real Madrid</a> on 19 November, as well as Barcelona's away victory over <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#Chelsea_v_Barcelona" title="2005–06 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">last 16 round</a> of the <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2005–06 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013279–284_62-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013279–284-62">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269_60-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269-60">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup> After he had scored 8 goals in 25 games, including his first in the Champions League,<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2005–06_63-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2005–06-63">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup> in a 5–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Panathinaikos_F.C." title="Panathinaikos F.C.">Panathinaikos</a> on 2 November 2005,<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup> his season ended prematurely during the return leg against Chelsea on 7 March 2006, when he suffered a torn hamstring. Messi worked to regain fitness in time for the Champions League <a href="/wiki/2006_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2006 UEFA Champions League Final">final</a>, but on 17 May, the day of the final, he was eventually ruled out. He was so disappointed that he did not celebrate his team's victory over <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> in <a href="/wiki/Paris" title="Paris">Paris</a>, something he later came to regret.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi,_Iniesta_and_Xavi_Driven_to_Join_the_Champions_League_Elite_54-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi,_Iniesta_and_Xavi_Driven_to_Join_the_Champions_League_Elite-54">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269_60-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter2012266–269-60">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>While Barcelona began a gradual decline, the 19-year-old Messi established himself as one of the best players in the world during the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2006–07 FC Barcelona season">2006–07 campaign</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ingla:_Rijkaard_to_Blame_for_Barça_Decline_65-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ingla:_Rijkaard_to_Blame_for_Barça_Decline-65">&#91;61&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best_66-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best-66">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup> Already an idol to the <i><a href="/wiki/Supporters_of_FC_Barcelona" title="Supporters of FC Barcelona">culés</a></i>, the club's supporters, he scored 17 goals  in 36 games across all competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best_66-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best-66">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2006–07_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2006–07-67">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup> However, he continued to be plagued by major injuries; a metatarsal fracture sustained on 12 November 2006 kept him out of action for three months.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Closing_in_on_Remarkable_Record_69-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Closing_in_on_Remarkable_Record-69">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup> He recovered in time for the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#First_knockout_round" title="2006–07 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">last 16 round</a> of the <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2006–07 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> against <a href="/wiki/Liverpool_F.C." title="Liverpool F.C.">Liverpool</a>, but was effectively marked out of the game; Barcelona, the reigning champions, were out of the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTETomkins2007130–132_70-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTETomkins2007130–132-70">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_La_Liga" title="2006–07 La Liga">In the league</a>, his goal contribution increased towards the end of the season; 11 of his 14 goals came from the last 13 games.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2006–07_67-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2006–07-67">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup> On 10 March 2007, he scored his first hat-trick in a <i>Clásico</i>, the first player to do so in 12 years, equalising after each goal by Real Madrid to end the match in a 3–3 draw in injury time.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup> His growing importance to the club was reflected in a new contract, signed that month, which greatly increased his wages.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013302_72-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013302-72">&#91;68&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg/220px-Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg/330px-Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg/440px-Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="540" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_goal_19abr2007.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi making his <a href="/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)#The_Goal_of_the_Century" title="Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)">Maradona-esque</a> run against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a> in April 2007</div></div></div>
<p>Already frequently compared to compatriot <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, Messi proved their similarity when he nearly replicated Maradona's two most famous goals in the span of seven weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-Maradona_Hails_His_Successor_73-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Maradona_Hails_His_Successor-73">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup> During a <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_Copa_del_Rey" title="2006–07 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_Copa_del_Rey#Semi-finals" title="2006–07 Copa del Rey">semi-final</a> against <a href="/wiki/Getafe_CF" title="Getafe CF">Getafe</a> on 18 April, he scored a goal remarkably similar to Maradona's second goal in the quarter-finals of the <a href="/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1986 FIFA World Cup">1986 FIFA World Cup</a>, known as the <a href="/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)#The_Goal_of_the_Century" title="Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)">Goal of the Century</a>. Messi collected the ball on the right side near the halfway line, ran 60 metres (66&#160;yd), and beat five defenders before scoring with an angled finish, just as Maradona had done.<sup id="cite_ref-On_a_Mission_25-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-On_a_Mission-25">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74">&#91;70&#93;</a></sup> A league match against Espanyol on 9 June saw him score by launching himself at the ball and guiding it past the goalkeeper with his hand in similar fashion to Maradona's <a href="/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)#&quot;Hand_of_God&quot;_goal" title="Argentina v England (1986 FIFA World Cup)">Hand of God goal</a> in the same World Cup match.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup> As Messi continued his individual rise, Barcelona faltered; the team failed to reach the <a href="/wiki/2007_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2007 Copa del Rey Final">Copa del Rey final</a> after Messi was rested during the second leg against Getafe and lost the league to Real Madrid on head-to-head results.<sup id="cite_ref-76" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-76">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">&#91;73&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After Ronaldinho lost form, Messi became Barça's new star player at only 20 years old, receiving the nickname "<a href="/wiki/Messiah" title="Messiah">Messiah</a>" from the Spanish media.<sup id="cite_ref-On_a_Mission_25-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-On_a_Mission-25">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78">&#91;74&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup> His efforts in 2007 also earned him award recognition; journalists voted him the third-best player of the year for the <a href="/wiki/2007_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2007 Ballon d&#39;Or">2007 Ballon d'Or</a>, behind <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> and runner-up <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>, while international managers and national team captains voted him <a href="/wiki/2007_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2007 FIFA World Player of the Year">second</a> for the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award, again behind Kaká.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_80-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524-80">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup> Although he managed to score 16 goals  during the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2007–08 FC Barcelona season">2007–08 campaign</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2007–08_82-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2007–08-82">&#91;78&#93;</a></sup> the second half of his season was again marred by injuries after he suffered a torn hamstring on 15 December.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Sidelined_for_Six_Weeks_83-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Sidelined_for_Six_Weeks-83">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> He returned to score twice in their away victory against <a href="/wiki/Celtic_F.C." title="Celtic F.C.">Celtic</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#First_knockout_round" title="2007–08 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">last 16 round</a> of the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2007–08 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a>, becoming the competition's top scorer at that point with six goals,<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">&#91;80&#93;</a></sup> but reinjured himself during the return leg on 4 March 2008. Rijkaard had fielded him despite warning from the medical staff, leading captain <a href="/wiki/Carles_Puyol" title="Carles Puyol">Carles Puyol</a> to criticise the Spanish media for pressuring Messi to play every match.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Sidelined_for_Six_Weeks_83-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Sidelined_for_Six_Weeks-83">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona finished the season without trophies, eliminated in the <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_stage#Semi-finals" title="2007–08 UEFA Champions League knockout stage">Champions League semi-finals</a> by the eventual <a href="/wiki/2008_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2008 UEFA Champions League Final">champions</a>, <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United" class="mw-redirect" title="Manchester United">Manchester United</a>, and <a href="/wiki/2007%E2%80%9308_La_Liga" title="2007–08 La Liga">placed third in the league</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>After two unsuccessful seasons, Barcelona were in need of an overhaul, leading to the departure of Rijkaard and Ronaldinho. Upon the latter's departure, Messi was given the <a href="/wiki/Squad_number_(association_football)" title="Squad number (association football)">number 10</a> shirt.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Has_Ronaldinho&#39;s_Number_61-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Has_Ronaldinho&#39;s_Number-61">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup> He signed a new contract in July 2008 on an annual salary of €7.8&#160;million, becoming the club's highest-paid player.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472_86-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472-86">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_Amazing_Talent_in_a_Reluctant_Star_87-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_Amazing_Talent_in_a_Reluctant_Star-87">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup> Ahead of the new season, a major concern remained his frequent muscular injuries, which had left him side-lined for a total of eight months between 2006 and 2008. To combat the problem, the club implemented new training, nutrition, and lifestyle regimens, and assigned him a personal physiotherapist, who would travel with him during call-ups for the <a href="/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team" title="Argentina national football team">Argentina national team</a>. As a result, Messi remained virtually injury-free during the next four years, allowing him to reach his full potential.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Closing_in_on_Remarkable_Record_69-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Closing_in_on_Remarkable_Record-69">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">&#91;84&#93;</a></sup> Despite his injuries early in the year, his performances in 2008 saw him again voted runner-up for the <a href="/wiki/2008_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2008 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2008_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year#Results" title="2008 FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award, both times behind Cristiano Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_80-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524-80">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">&#91;85&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2009.E2.80.9311:_Sustained_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2009–11:_Sustained_success">2009–11: Sustained success</span></h4>
<p>In his first uninterrupted campaign, the <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2008–09 FC Barcelona season">2008–09 season</a>, he scored 38 goals  in 51 games, contributing alongside Eto'o and winger <a href="/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a> to a total of 100 goals in all competitions, a record at the time for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2008–09_90-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2008–09-90">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009,_Rome.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg/220px-039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg/330px-039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg/440px-039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009%2C_Rome.jpg 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="450" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:039_men_at_work_UEFA_2009,_Rome.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi aiming to shoot during the <a href="/wiki/2009_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2009 UEFA Champions League Final">Champions League final</a> against <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> in May 2009</div></div></div>
<p>During his first season under Barcelona's new manager, former captain <a href="/wiki/Pep_Guardiola" title="Pep Guardiola">Pep Guardiola</a>, Messi played mainly on the right wing, like he had under Rijkaard, though this time as a false winger with the freedom to cut inside and roam the centre. During the <i>Clásico</i> on 2 May 2009, however, he played for the first time as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#False_9" title="Forward (association football)">false nine</a>, positioned as a centre-forward but dropping deep into midfield to link up with <a href="/wiki/Xavi" title="Xavi">Xavi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a>. He assisted his side's first goal and scored twice to end the match in an emphatic 6–2 victory, the team's greatest-ever score at Real Madrid's <a href="/wiki/Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u_Stadium" title="Santiago Bernabéu Stadium">Santiago Bernabéu Stadium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013453–459_92-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013453–459-92">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup> Returning to the wing, he played his first final since breaking into the first team on 13 May, scoring once and assisting a second goal as Barcelona defeated <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> <a href="/wiki/2009_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2009 Copa del Rey Final">4–1</a> to win the <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_Copa_del_Rey" title="2008–09 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> With 23 league goals from Messi that season, Barcelona became <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_La_Liga" title="2008–09 La Liga">La Liga champions</a> three days later and achieved its fifth <a href="/wiki/Double_(association_football)" title="Double (association football)">double</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2008–09_90-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2008–09-90">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">&#91;91&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As the season's <a href="/wiki/List_of_European_Cup_and_UEFA_Champions_League_top_scorers#Top_scorers_by_seasons" class="mw-redirect" title="List of European Cup and UEFA Champions League top scorers">Champions League top scorer</a> with nine goals, the youngest in the tournament's history,<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">&#91;92&#93;</a></sup> Messi scored two goals and assisted two more to ensure a 4–0 <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Quarter-finals" title="2008–09 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">quarter-final</a> victory over <a href="/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013453–459_92-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013453–459-92">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup> He returned as a false nine during the <a href="/wiki/2009_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2009 UEFA Champions League Final">final</a> on 27 May in <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">Rome</a> against Manchester United. Barcelona were crowned champions of Europe by winning the match 2–0, the second goal coming from a Messi header over goalkeeper <a href="/wiki/Edwin_van_der_Sar" title="Edwin van der Sar">Edwin van der Sar</a>. Barcelona thus achieved the first <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">treble</a> in the history of Spanish football.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">&#91;93&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">&#91;94&#93;</a></sup> This success was reflected in a new contract, signed on 18 September, which committed Messi to the club through 2016 with a new buyout clause of €250&#160;million, while his salary increased to €12&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472_86-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472-86">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup> His team's prosperity continued into the second half of 2009, as Barcelona became the first club to achieve the sextuple, winning six top-tier trophies in a single year.<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">&#91;95&#93;</a></sup> After victories in the <a href="/wiki/2009_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2009 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a> and <a href="/wiki/2009_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2009 UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a> in August, Barcelona won the <a href="/wiki/2009_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2009 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> against <a href="/wiki/Estudiantes_de_La_Plata" title="Estudiantes de La Plata">Estudiantes de La Plata</a> on 19 December, with Messi scoring the winning 2–1 goal with his chest.<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">&#91;96&#93;</a></sup> At 22 years old, Messi won the <a href="/wiki/2009_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2009 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2009_FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="2009 FIFA World Player of the Year">FIFA World Player of the Year</a> award, both times by the greatest voting margin in each trophy's history.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_80-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524-80">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"Messi is the best player in the world by some distance. He's like a PlayStation. He can take advantage of every mistake we make."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="/wiki/Ars%C3%A8ne_Wenger" title="Arsène Wenger">Arsène Wenger</a> commends Messi for his four–goal display against <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a> in April 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Unsatisfied with his position on the right wing – with the club's summer acquisition <a href="/wiki/Zlatan_Ibrahimovi%C4%87" title="Zlatan Ibrahimovi">Zlatan Ibrahimovi</a> occupying the central forward role – Messi resumed playing as a false nine in early 2010, beginning with a <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2009–10 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Round_of_16" title="2009–10 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">last 16-round</a> match against <a href="/wiki/VfB_Stuttgart" title="VfB Stuttgart">VfB Stuttgart</a>. After a first-leg draw, Barcelona won the second leg 4–0 with two goals and an assist from Messi. At that point, he effectively became the tactical focal point of Guardiola's team, and his goalscoring rate increased.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013476–478_102-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013476–478-102">&#91;98&#93;</a></sup> Messi scored a total of 47 goals in all competitions <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2009–10 FC Barcelona season">that season</a>, equaling <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>'s club record from the <a href="/wiki/1996%E2%80%9397_FC_Barcelona_season" title="1996–97 FC Barcelona season">1996–97 campaign</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2009–10_103-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2009–10-103">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-La_Liga_Title_the_Least_Barcelona_Deserve_as_Madrid_Again_Finish_Empty_Handed_104-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-La_Liga_Title_the_Least_Barcelona_Deserve_as_Madrid_Again_Finish_Empty_Handed-104">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup> He scored all of his side's four goals in the <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Quarter-finals" title="2009–10 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">Champions League quarter-final</a> against <a href="/wiki/Ars%C3%A8ne_Wenger" title="Arsène Wenger">Arsène Wenger</a>'s Arsenal on 6 April while becoming Barcelona's all-time top scorer in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">&#91;101&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> Although Barcelona were eliminated in the <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Semi-finals" title="2009–10 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">Champions League semi-finals</a> by the eventual <a href="/wiki/2010_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2010 UEFA Champions League Final">champions</a>, Inter Milan, Messi finished the season as top scorer (with 8 goals) for the second consecutive year.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">&#91;103&#93;</a></sup> As the league's top scorer with 34 goals (again tying Ronaldo's record), he helped Barcelona win a <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_La_Liga" title="2009–10 La Liga">second consecutive La Liga</a> trophy with only a single defeat.<sup id="cite_ref-La_Liga_Title_the_Least_Barcelona_Deserve_as_Madrid_Again_Finish_Empty_Handed_104-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-La_Liga_Title_the_Least_Barcelona_Deserve_as_Madrid_Again_Finish_Empty_Handed-104">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;104&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:FC_Barcelona_Team_2,_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg/220px-FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="153" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg/330px-FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg/440px-FC_Barcelona_Team_2%2C_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4972" data-file-height="3456" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:FC_Barcelona_Team_2,_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi (centre) and his teammates celebrating winning the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> in December 2011</div></div></div>
<p>Messi secured Barcelona's first trophy of the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2010–11 FC Barcelona season">2010–11 campaign</a>, the <a href="/wiki/2010_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2010 Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a>, by scoring a hat-trick in his side's second-leg 4–0 victory over Sevilla, after a first-leg defeat.<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109">&#91;105&#93;</a></sup> Assuming a playmaking role, he was again instrumental in a <i>Clásico</i> on 29 November 2010, the first with José Mourinho in charge of Real Madrid, as Barcelona defeated their rivals 5–0.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup> Messi helped the team achieve 16 consecutive league victories, a record in Spanish football, concluding with another hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a> on 5 February 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-112" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-112">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup> His club performances in 2010 <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or#Winners_and_nominees" title="2010 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">earned him</a> the inaugural <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a>, an amalgamation of the Ballon d'Or and the FIFA World Player of the Year award, though his win was met with some criticism due to his lack of success with Argentina at the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_80-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524-80">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_Player_but_Xavi_Deserved_FIFA&#39;s_Award_113-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_Player_but_Xavi_Deserved_FIFA&#39;s_Award-113">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> Under the award's old format, he would have placed just outside the top three, owing his win to the votes from the international coaches and captains.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_Player_but_Xavi_Deserved_FIFA&#39;s_Award_113-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_Player_but_Xavi_Deserved_FIFA&#39;s_Award-113">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Towards the end of the season, Barcelona played four <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">Clásicos</a></i> in the span of 18 days. A league match on 16 April ended in a draw after a penalty from Messi. After Barcelona lost the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2011 Copa del Rey Final">Copa del Rey final</a> four days later, Messi scored both goals in his side's 2–0 win in the first leg of the <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2010–11 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Semi-finals" title="2010–11 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">semi-finals</a> in Madrid, the second of which – a slaloming dribble past three Real players – was acclaimed as one of the best ever in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> Although he did not score, he was again important in the second-leg draw that sent Barcelona through to the <a href="/wiki/2011_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2011 UEFA Champions League Final">Champions League final</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-The_Good,_the_Bad_and_the_Ugly_in_the_Aftermatch_of_the_Clásico_Series_115-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Good,_the_Bad_and_the_Ugly_in_the_Aftermatch_of_the_Clásico_Series-115">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013494–499_116-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013494–499-116">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup> where they faced Manchester United in a repeat of the final two years earlier. As the competition's top scorer for the third consecutive year, with 12 goals, Messi gave a man-of-the-match performance at <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley</a> on 28 May, scoring the match-winning goal of Barça's 3–1 victory.<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona won a <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">third consecutive La Liga title</a>. In addition to his 31 goals, Messi was also the league's top assist provider with 18.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2010–11_119-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2010–11-119">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup> He finished the season with 53 goals and 24 assists in all competitions, becoming Barcelona's all-time single-season top scorer and the first player in Spanish football to reach the 50-goal benchmark.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2010–11_119-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2010–11-119">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Is_Sublime_Lionel_Messi_the_Greatest_Footballer_Ever?_121-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Is_Sublime_Lionel_Messi_the_Greatest_Footballer_Ever?-121">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As Messi developed into a combination of a number 8 (a creator), a 9 (scorer), and a 10 (assistant),<sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> he scored an unprecedented 73 goals and provided 29 assists in all club competitions during the <a href="/wiki/2011%E2%80%9312_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2011–12 FC Barcelona season">2011–12 season</a>, producing a hat-trick or more on 10 occasions.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013512_123-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013512-123">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2011–12_124-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2011–12-124">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi:_The_Best_Goalscorer_Ever_but_Is_the_Barcelona_Player_the_Greatest-Ever_Footballer?_125-0" class="reference"><a
