In the interview, Messi claimed to have informed Barcelona of his desire to leave multiple times, and club president <a href="/wiki/Josep_Maria_Bartomeu" title="Josep Maria Bartomeu">Josep Bartomeu</a> said Messi could decide at the end of every season if he could stay or leave, only for Bartomeu to refer to the release clause.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup> This left Messi with two options: to stay or go to court against the club, with the player saying "I would never go to court against the club of my life".<sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2020.E2.80.9321:_Most_goals_scored_for_a_club_and_most_appearances_for_Barcelona"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2020–21:_Most_goals_scored_for_a_club_and_most_appearances_for_Barcelona">2020–21: Most goals scored for a club and most appearances for Barcelona</span></h4>
<p>On 27 September, Messi began the <a href="/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2020–21 FC Barcelona season">2020–21 season</a> by scoring a penalty in a 4–0 home win against Villarreal in La Liga.<sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">&#91;300&#93;</a></sup> Two days prior to the opening game, he again criticised the club, this time for the manner of <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>'s departure, stating, "at this stage nothing surprises me any more".<sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup> On 20 October, Messi scored a penalty and assisted the fifth goal in a 5–1 home victory against <a href="/wiki/Ferencv%C3%A1rosi_TC" title="Ferencvárosi TC">Ferencváros</a> in the Champions League, becoming the first player in history to score in sixteen consecutive Champions League seasons.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup> On 25 November, the Argentine was nominated for the <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Football_Awards_2020" title="The Best FIFA Football Awards 2020">2020 Best FIFA Men's Player award</a>, and was later shortlisted as one of the final three candidates.<sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">&#91;303&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-309">&#91;304&#93;</a></sup> On 29 November, Messi scored his side's fourth goal in their 4–0 victory over Osasuna. After scoring, he unveiled a shirt of his former side <a href="/wiki/Newell%27s_Old_Boys" title="Newell&#39;s Old Boys">Newell's Old Boys</a>, in tribute to Argentine compatriot <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who had passed away four days earlier, and raised both hands to the screen showing Maradona's face in the stadium. The shirt was a number 10 replica of the same one Maradona had worn during his stint with the club in 1993.<sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">&#91;305&#93;</a></sup> On 17 December, Messi finished third in The Best FIFA Men's Player award behind <a href="/wiki/Robert_Lewandowski" title="Robert Lewandowski">Robert Lewandowski</a> and Cristiano Ronaldo, and was included in the <a href="/wiki/FIFPro#FIFA_FIFPro_Men&#39;s_World11" title="FIFPro">FIFA FIFPro World XI</a> for the fourteenth consecutive year.<sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p>On 23 December, Messi scored his 644th goal for Barcelona against Real Valladolid in La Liga, surpassing <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> with <a href="/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos</a> as the player with the most goals scored for a single club.<sup id="cite_ref-312" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-312">&#91;307&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">&#91;308&#93;</a></sup> In order to celebrate his achievement, <a href="/wiki/Budweiser" title="Budweiser">Budweiser</a> sent personalised bottles of beer to every goalkeeper whom Messi has scored against.<sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314">&#91;309&#93;</a></sup> On 17 January 2021, Messi was <a href="/wiki/Fouls_and_misconduct_(association_football)#Red_card_(dismissal)" title="Fouls and misconduct (association football)">sent off</a> for the first time in his club career for violent conduct (swinging an arm at the head of <a href="/wiki/Asier_Villalibre" title="Asier Villalibre">Asier Villalibre</a>, missed initially by the referee but reviewed via <a href="/wiki/Video_assistant_referee" title="Video assistant referee">VAR</a>) in the final minutes of Barcelona's 2–3 extra time defeat to Athletic Bilbao in the <a href="/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a_Final" class="mw-redirect" title="2020–21 Supercopa de España Final">2020–21 Supercopa de España Final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315">&#91;310&#93;</a></sup> On 10 March, Messi scored from 35 yards out and later had a penalty saved in a 1–1 draw against <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain F.C.</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Parc_des_Princes" title="Parc des Princes">Parc des Princes</a> in the second leg of the <a href="/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Round_of_16" title="2020–21 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">Champions League round of 16</a> as Barcelona were eliminated at this stage for the first time in 14 years by an aggregate score of 2–5 after having lost 1–4 at home on 16 February.<sup id="cite_ref-316" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-316">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> On 15 March, Messi equalled Xavi's record of 767 overall appearances for the club, scoring twice and getting an assist in Barcelona's 4–1 win over <a href="/wiki/SD_Huesca" title="SD Huesca">Huesca</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-317" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-317">&#91;312&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_career">International career</span></h2>
<h3><span id="2004.E2.80.9305:_Success_at_youth_level"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2004–05:_Success_at_youth_level">2004–05: Success at youth level</span></h3>
<p>As a dual Argentine-Spanish national, Messi was eligible to play for the national team of both countries.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi_318-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi-318">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup> Selectors for Spain's Under-17 squad began pursuing him in 2003 after Barcelona's director of football, <a href="/wiki/Carles_Rexach" title="Carles Rexach">Carles Rexach</a>, alerted the Royal Spanish Football Federation to their young player. Messi declined the offer, having aspired to represent <i>La Albiceleste</i> since childhood. To further prevent Spain from taking him, the <a href="/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association" title="Argentine Football Association">Argentine Football Association</a> organised two under-20 friendlies in June 2004, against Paraguay and Uruguay, with the purpose of finalising his status as an Argentina player in <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a>. Five days after his 17th birthday, on 29 June, he made his debut for his country against Paraguay, scoring once and providing two assists in their 8–0 victory. He was subsequently included in the squad for the <a href="/wiki/2005_South_American_U-20_Championship" title="2005 South American U-20 Championship">South American Youth Championship</a>, held in Colombia in February 2005. As he lacked the stamina of his teammates, the result of his former growth hormone deficiency, he was used as a substitute in six of the nine games. After being named man of the match against Venezuela, he scored the winning 2–1 goal in the crucial last match against Brazil, thereby securing their third-place qualification for the <a href="/wiki/2005_FIFA_World_Youth_Championship" title="2005 FIFA World Youth Championship">FIFA World Youth Championship</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013209–219_319-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013209–219-319">&#91;314&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Aware of his physical limitations, Messi employed a personal trainer to increase his muscle mass, returning to the squad in an improved condition in time for the World Youth Championship, hosted by the Netherlands in June 2005. After he was left out of the starting line-up in their first match against the United States, a 1–0 defeat, the squad's senior players asked manager Francisco Ferraro to let Messi start, as they considered him their best player. After helping the team defeat Egypt and Germany to progress past the group stage, Messi proved decisive in the knockout phase as he scored their equaliser against Colombia, provided a goal and an assist against title favourites Spain, and scored their opening goal against reigning champions Brazil. Ahead of the final, he was awarded the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_U-20_World_Cup#Awards" title="FIFA U-20 World Cup">Golden Ball</a> as the best player of the tournament. He scored two penalties in their 2–1 victory over Nigeria, clinching Argentina's fifth championship and finishing the tournament as top scorer with 6 goals.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013220–240_320-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013220–240-320">&#91;315&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands_321-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands-321">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup> His performances drew comparisons with compatriot <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, who had led Argentina to the <a href="/wiki/1979_FIFA_World_Youth_Championship" title="1979 FIFA World Youth Championship">title in 1979</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands_321-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands-321">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2005.E2.80.9306:_Senior_and_World_Cup_debuts"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2005–06:_Senior_and_World_Cup_debuts">2005–06: Senior and World Cup debuts</span></h3>
<p>In recognition of his achievements with the under-20 side, senior manager <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_P%C3%A9kerman" title="José Pékerman">José Pékerman</a> gave Messi his first call-up for a friendly against <a href="/wiki/Hungary_national_football_team" title="Hungary national football team">Hungary</a> on 17 August 2005. Aged 18, Messi made his senior debut for Argentina in the <a href="/wiki/Ferenc_Pusk%C3%A1s_Stadium_(1953)" class="mw-redirect" title="Ferenc Puskás Stadium (1953)">Ferenc Puskás Stadium</a> when he came on in the 63rd minute, only to be sent off after two minutes for a perceived foul against <a href="/wiki/Vilmos_Vancz%C3%A1k" title="Vilmos Vanczák">Vilmos Vanczák</a>, who had grabbed his shirt; Messi had struck the defender with his arm while trying to shake him off, which the referee interpreted as an intentional elbowing, a contentious decision.<sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322">&#91;317&#93;</a></sup> Messi was reportedly found weeping in the dressing room after his sending-off.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">&#91;318&#93;</a></sup> He returned to the team on 3 September in their World Cup qualifier defeat to <a href="/wiki/Paraguay_national_football_team" title="Paraguay national football team">Paraguay</a>, which he had declared his "re-debut" ahead of the match.<sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> Messi started his first game in the next qualifying match against <a href="/wiki/Peru_national_football_team" title="Peru national football team">Peru</a>, in which he was able to win a crucial penalty that secured their victory. After the match, Pékerman described him as "a jewel".<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">&#91;320&#93;</a></sup> He subsequently made regular appearances for the team ahead of Argentina's participation in the <a href="/wiki/2006_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2006 FIFA World Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a>, scoring his first goal in a friendly against <a href="/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a> on 1 March 2006.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup> A hamstring injury sustained a week later jeopardised his presence in the World Cup, but he was nevertheless selected for Pékerman's squad and regained fitness in time for the start of the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">&#91;322&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During the World Cup in Germany, Messi witnessed their opening match victory against the <a href="/wiki/Ivory_Coast_national_football_team" title="Ivory Coast national football team">Ivory Coast</a> from the substitutes' bench. In the next match, against <a href="/wiki/Serbia_national_football_team" title="Serbia national football team">Serbia and Montenegro</a>, he became the youngest player to represent Argentina at a <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> when he came on as a substitute in the 74th minute. He assisted their fourth strike within minutes and scored the final goal in their 6–0 victory, making him the youngest scorer in the tournament and the sixth-youngest goalscorer in the history of the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-Argentina_6–0_Serbia_&amp;_Montenegro_328-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Argentina_6–0_Serbia_&amp;_Montenegro-328">&#91;323&#93;</a></sup> As their progression to the knockout phase was secured, several starters were rested during the last group match. Messi consequently started the game against the <a href="/wiki/Netherlands_national_football_team" title="Netherlands national football team">Netherlands</a>, a 0–0 draw, as they won their group on goal differential.<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">&#91;324&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011470–471_330-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011470–471-330">&#91;325&#93;</a></sup> In the round of 16 match against <a href="/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team" title="Mexico national football team">Mexico</a>, played on his 19th birthday, Messi came on in the 84th minute, with the score tied at 1–1. He appeared to score a goal, but it was contentiously ruled <a href="/wiki/Offside_(association_football)" title="Offside (association football)">offside</a>, with the team needing a late goal in extra time to proceed.<sup id="cite_ref-331" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-331">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011485–486_332-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011485–486-332">&#91;327&#93;</a></sup> He did not play in the quarter-final against Germany, during which Argentina were eliminated 4–2 in a penalty shootout.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011492–493_333-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011492–493-333">&#91;328&#93;</a></sup> Back home, Pékerman's decision to leave him on the bench against Germany led to widespread criticism from those who believed Messi could have changed the outcome of the match in Argentina's favour.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013382–383_334-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013382–383-334">&#91;329&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-335" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-335">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2007.E2.80.9308:_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_final_and_Olympic_gold"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2007–08:_Copa_América_final_and_Olympic_gold">2007–08: Copa América final and Olympic gold</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Olymics_final_2008.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Olymics_final_2008.jpg/220px-Olymics_final_2008.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Olymics_final_2008.jpg/330px-Olymics_final_2008.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d8/Olymics_final_2008.jpg/440px-Olymics_final_2008.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="900" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Olymics_final_2008.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi evades Brazil's <a href="/wiki/Marcelo_(footballer,_born_1988)" title="Marcelo (footballer, born 1988)">Marcelo</a> in the semi-final of the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a> in Beijing, China</div></div></div>
<p>As Messi evolved into one of the best players in the world, he secured a place in <a href="/wiki/Alfio_Basile" title="Alfio Basile">Alfio Basile</a>'s starting line-up, as part of a team considered favourites to win the <a href="/wiki/2007_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2007 Copa América">2007 Copa América</a>, held in Venezuela.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best_66-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best-66">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387_336-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387-336">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> He set up the game-winning goal of their 4–1 victory over the <a href="/wiki/United_States_national_men%27s_soccer_team" class="mw-redirect" title="United States national men&#39;s soccer team">United States</a> in the opening match, before winning a penalty that led to the game-tying first strike of their 4–2 win in the next match against <a href="/wiki/Colombia_national_football_team" title="Colombia national football team">Colombia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">&#91;332&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-338" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-338">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup> As they had secured their place in the knockout phase, Messi started the next game on the bench, coming on in the last 25 minutes with the score at 0–0 to help his team defeat Paraguay by assisting their only goal. At the quarter-final stage, where the group winners faced Peru, he scored the second goal of a 4–0 victory that saw them through to the semi-final, during which he chipped the ball over Mexico's goalkeeper to ensure another 3–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387_336-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387-336">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> In a surprise defeat, Argentina lost the final 3–0 to a <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> squad that lacked several of the nation's best players.<sup id="cite_ref-Missing_Some_Stars,_Brazil_Wins_Copa_América_339-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Missing_Some_Stars,_Brazil_Wins_Copa_América-339">&#91;334&#93;</a></sup> Their unexpected loss was followed by much criticism in Argentina, though Messi was mostly exempt due to his young age and secondary status to star player <a href="/wiki/Juan_Rom%C3%A1n_Riquelme" title="Juan Román Riquelme">Juan Román Riquelme</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387_336-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387-336">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> He was named the best young player of the tournament by <a href="/wiki/CONMEBOL" title="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli2012156_340-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli2012156-340">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ahead of the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2008_Summer_Olympics" title="Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics">2008 Summer Olympics</a>, Barcelona legally barred Messi from representing Argentina at the tournament as it coincided with their Champions League qualifying matches.<sup id="cite_ref-341" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-341">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup> After interference from newly appointed Barcelona manager Pep Guardiola, who had <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_1992_Summer_Olympics" title="Football at the 1992 Summer Olympics">won the tournament in 1992</a>, Messi was permitted to join <a href="/wiki/Sergio_Batista" title="Sergio Batista">Sergio Batista</a>'s under-23 squad in Beijing.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter201263–64_342-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter201263–64-342">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup> During the first match, he scored the opening goal and assisted another in their 2–1 victory over the <a href="/wiki/Ivory_Coast_national_under-23_football_team" title="Ivory Coast national under-23 football team">Ivory Coast</a>. Following a 1–0 win in the next group match against <a href="/wiki/Australia_national_under-23_soccer_team" title="Australia national under-23 soccer team">Australia</a>, ensuring their quarter-final qualification, Messi was rested during the game against Serbia, while his side won the match to finish first in their group. Against the Netherlands, he again scored the first goal and assisted a second strike to help his team to a 2–1 win in extra time. After a 3–0 semi-final victory over <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_under-23_football_team" title="Brazil national under-23 football team">Brazil</a>, Messi assisted the only goal in the final as Argentina defeated <a href="/wiki/Nigeria_national_under-23_football_team" title="Nigeria national under-23 football team">Nigeria</a> to claim <a href="/wiki/Olympic_medal" title="Olympic medal">Olympic gold medals</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013436–437_343-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013436–437-343">&#91;338&#93;</a></sup> Along with Riquelme, Messi was singled out by FIFA as the stand-out player from the tournament's best team.<sup id="cite_ref-344" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-344">&#91;339&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2008.E2.80.9311:_Collective_decline"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2008–11:_Collective_decline">2008–11: Collective decline</span></h3>
<p>From late 2008, the national team experienced a three-year period marked by poor performances.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387_336-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013384–387-336">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> Under manager Diego Maradona, who had led Argentina to World Cup victory as a player, the team struggled to qualify for the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 World Cup</a>, securing their place in the tournament only after defeating <a href="/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team" title="Uruguay national football team">Uruguay</a> 1–0 in their last qualifying match. Maradona was criticised for his strategic decisions, which included playing Messi out of his usual position. In eight qualifying matches under Maradona's stewardship, Messi scored only one goal, netting the opening goal in the first such match, a 4–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/Venezuela_national_football_team" title="Venezuela national football team">Venezuela</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539_345-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539-345">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup> During that game, played on 28 March 2009, he wore Argentina's number 10 shirt for the first time, following the international retirement of Riquelme.<sup id="cite_ref-346" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-346">&#91;341&#93;</a></sup> Overall, Messi scored four goals in 18 appearances during the qualifying process.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup> Ahead of the tournament, Maradona visited Messi in Barcelona to request his tactical input; Messi then outlined a 4–3–1–2 formation with himself playing behind the two strikers, a playmaking position known as the <i>enganche</i> in Argentine football, which had been his preferred position since childhood.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013155–156,_405–406_347-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013155–156,_405–406-347">&#91;342&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg/170px-Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg/255px-Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg/340px-Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="363" data-file-height="484" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_Copa_America_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi in action during the opening match against Bolivia in the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a></div></div></div>
<p>Despite their poor qualifying campaign, Argentina were considered title contenders at the World Cup in South Africa. At the start of the tournament, the new formation proved effective; Messi managed at least four attempts on goal during their opening match but was repeatedly denied by <a href="/wiki/Nigeria_national_football_team" title="Nigeria national football team">Nigeria</a>'s goalkeeper, resulting in a 1–0 win. During the next match, against <a href="/wiki/South_Korea_national_football_team" title="South Korea national football team">South Korea</a>, he excelled in his playmaking role, participating in all four goals of his side's 4–1 victory. As their place in the knockout phase was guaranteed, most of the starters were rested during the last group match, but Messi reportedly refused to be benched.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539_345-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539-345">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup> He wore the captain's armband for the first time in their 2–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Greece_national_football_team" title="Greece national football team">Greece</a>; as the focal point of their play, he helped create their second goal to see Argentina finish as group winners.<sup id="cite_ref-348" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-348">&#91;343&#93;</a></sup> In the round of 16, they defeated Mexico 3–1, with Messi assisting their first goal, a controversial strike that stood despite being offside.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011564–567_349-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011564–567-349">&#91;344&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Argentina were eliminated in the quarter-final against Germany, at the same stage of the tournament and by the same opponent as four years earlier. Their 4–0 loss was their worst margin of defeat at a World Cup since 1974.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011564–567_349-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011564–567-349">&#91;344&#93;</a></sup> FIFA subsequently identified Messi as one of the tournament's 10 best players, citing his "outstanding" pace and creativity and "spectacular and efficient" dribbling, shooting and passing.<sup id="cite_ref-350" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-350">&#91;345&#93;</a></sup> Back home, however, Messi was the subject of harsher judgement. As the perceived best player in the world, he had been expected to lead an average team to the title, as Maradona arguably <a href="/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1986 FIFA World Cup">did in 1986</a>, but he had failed to replicate his performances at Barcelona with the national team, leading to the accusation that he cared less about his country than his club.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_351-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420-351">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Maradona was replaced by Sergio Batista, who had orchestrated Argentina's Olympic victory. Batista publicly stated that he intended to build the team around Messi, employing him as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#False_9" title="Forward (association football)">false nine</a> within a 4–3–3 system, as used to much success by Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_351-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420-351">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Showing_Some_Promising_Signs_in_a_New_Argentina_Role_352-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Showing_Some_Promising_Signs_in_a_New_Argentina_Role-352">&#91;347&#93;</a></sup> Although Messi scored a record 53 goals during the 2010–11 club season, he had not scored for Argentina in an official match since March 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-Matches_2010–11_119-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matches_2010–11-119">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup> Despite the tactical change, his goal drought continued during the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a>, hosted by Argentina. Their first two matches, against Bolivia and Colombia, ended in draws. Media and fans noted that he did not combine well with striker <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Tevez" title="Carlos Tevez">Carlos Tevez</a>, who enjoyed greater popularity among the Argentine public; Messi was consequently booed by his own team's supporters for the first time in his career. During the crucial next match, with Tevez on the bench, he gave a well-received performance, assisting two goals in their 3–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/Costa_Rica_national_football_team" title="Costa Rica national football team">Costa Rica</a>. After the quarter-final against Uruguay ended in a 1–1 draw following extra time, with Messi having assisted their equaliser, Argentina were eliminated 4–5 in the penalty shootout by the eventual champions.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_351-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420-351">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2011.E2.80.9313:_Assuming_the_captaincy"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2011–13:_Assuming_the_captaincy">2011–13: Assuming the captaincy</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg/170px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg/255px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg/340px-Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="2000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Suisse_vs_Argentine_-_Granit_Xhaka_%26_Lionel_Messi_crop.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi scored his first international <a href="/wiki/Hat-trick" title="Hat-trick">hat-trick</a> against <a href="/wiki/Switzerland_national_football_team" title="Switzerland national football team">Switzerland</a> in February 2012</div></div></div>
<p>After Argentina's unsuccessful performance in the Copa América, Batista was replaced by <a href="/wiki/Alejandro_Sabella" title="Alejandro Sabella">Alejandro Sabella</a>. Upon his appointment in August 2011, Sabella awarded the 24-year-old Messi the captaincy of the squad, in accord with then-captain <a href="/wiki/Javier_Mascherano" title="Javier Mascherano">Javier Mascherano</a>. Reserved by nature, Messi went on to lead his squad by example as their best player, while Mascherano continued to fulfil the role of the team's on-field leader and motivator.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602_353-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602-353">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-354" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-354">&#91;349&#93;</a></sup> In a further redesign of the team, Sabella dismissed Tevez and brought in players with whom Messi had won the World Youth Championship and Olympic Games. Now playing in a free role in an improving team, Messi ended his goal drought by scoring during their first World Cup qualifying match against <a href="/wiki/Chile_national_football_team" title="Chile national football team">Chile</a> on 7 October, his first official goal for Argentina in two-and-a-half years.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602_353-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602-353">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Under Sabella, Messi's goalscoring rate drastically increased; where he had scored only 17 goals in 61 matches under his previous managers, he scored 25 times in 32 appearances during the following three years.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602_353-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602-353">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup> He netted a total of 12 goals in 9 games for Argentina in 2012, equalling the record held by <a href="/wiki/Gabriel_Batistuta" title="Gabriel Batistuta">Gabriel Batistuta</a> for the most goals scored in a calendar year for their country.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Incredible_Record-Breaking_Year_in_Numbers_355-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Incredible_Record-Breaking_Year_in_Numbers-355">&#91;350&#93;</a></sup> His first hat-trick with the <i>Albicelestes</i> came in a friendly against <a href="/wiki/Switzerland_national_football_team" title="Switzerland national football team">Switzerland</a> on 29 February 2012, followed by two more hat-tricks over the next year-and-a-half in friendlies against Brazil and <a href="/wiki/Guatemala_national_football_team" title="Guatemala national football team">Guatemala</a>. Messi then helped the team secure their place in the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 World Cup</a> with a 5–2 victory over Paraguay on 10 September 2013; in addition to providing an assist, he scored twice from a penalty kick, taking his international tally to 37 goals to become Argentina's second-highest goalscorer behind Batistuta. Overall, he had scored a total of 10 goals in 14 matches during the qualifying campaign.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-356" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-356">&#91;351&#93;</a></sup> Concurrently with his bettered performances, his relationship with his compatriots improved, as he gradually began to be perceived more favourably in Argentina.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602_353-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013595–602-353">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2014.E2.80.9315:_World_Cup_and_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_finals"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2014–15:_World_Cup_and_Copa_América_finals">2014–15: World Cup and Copa América finals</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Iran_vs._Argentina_match,_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg/220px-Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="158" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg/330px-Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/85/Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg/440px-Iran_vs._Argentina_match%2C_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg 2x" data-file-width="734" data-file-height="527" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Iran_vs._Argentina_match,_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_37.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi watches his 25-yard curling strike hit the net against <a href="/wiki/Iran_national_football_team" title="Iran national football team">Iran</a> to win the game for Argentina in their second group game at the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>Ahead of the World Cup in Brazil, doubts persisted over Messi's form, as he finished an unsuccessful and injury-plagued season with Barcelona. At the start of the tournament, however, he gave strong performances, being elected man of the match in their first four matches.<sup id="cite_ref-2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Brazil_Technical_Report_and_Statistics_357-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Brazil_Technical_Report_and_Statistics-357">&#91;352&#93;</a></sup> In his first World Cup match as captain, he led them to a 2–1 victory over <a href="/wiki/Bosnia_and_Herzegovina_national_football_team" title="Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>; he helped create <a href="/wiki/Sead_Kola%C5%A1inac" title="Sead Kolašinac">Sead Kolašinac</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Own_goal" title="Own goal">own goal</a> and scored their second strike after a dribble past three players, his first World Cup goal since his debut in the tournament eight years earlier.<sup id="cite_ref-358" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-358">&#91;353&#93;</a></sup> During the second match against <a href="/wiki/Iran_national_football_team" title="Iran national football team">Iran</a>, he scored an injury-time goal from 25 yards out to end the game in a 1–0 win, securing their qualification for the knockout phase.<sup id="cite_ref-359" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-359">&#91;354&#93;</a></sup> He scored twice in the last group match, a 3–2 victory over Nigeria, his second goal from a free kick, as they finished first in their group.<sup id="cite_ref-360" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-360">&#91;355&#93;</a></sup> Messi assisted a late goal in extra time to ensure a 1–0 win against Switzerland in the round of 16, before starting the play that led to their match-winning 1–0 goal in the quarter-final against <a href="/wiki/Belgium_national_football_team" title="Belgium national football team">Belgium</a>, helping Argentina progress to the semi-final of the World Cup for the first time since <a href="/wiki/1990_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1990 FIFA World Cup">1990</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-361" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-361">&#91;356&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-362" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-362">&#91;357&#93;</a></sup> Following a 0–0 draw in extra time, they eliminated the Netherlands 4–2 in a penalty shootout to reach the final, with Messi scoring his team's first penalty.<sup id="cite_ref-363" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-363">&#91;358&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_(24).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg/170px-Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg/255px-Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/87/Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg/340px-Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_%2824%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="998" data-file-height="1331" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_in_Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_-2014-07-13_(24).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi battles Germany's <a href="/wiki/Mats_Hummels" title="Mats Hummels">Mats Hummels</a> for the ball during the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup Final">final</a> of the 2014 FIFA World Cup</div></div></div>
<p>Billed as Messi versus Germany, the world's best player against the best team, the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup Final">final</a> was a repeat of the <a href="/wiki/1990_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" title="1990 FIFA World Cup Final">1990 final</a> featuring Diego Maradona.<sup id="cite_ref-364" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-364">&#91;359&#93;</a></sup> Within the first half-hour, Messi had started the play that led to a goal, but it was ruled offside. He missed several opportunities to open the scoring throughout the match, in particular at the start of the second half when his breakaway effort went wide of the far post. Substitute <a href="/wiki/Mario_G%C3%B6tze" title="Mario Götze">Mario Götze</a> finally scored in the 113th minute, followed in the last minute of extra time by a free kick that Messi sent over the net, as Germany won the match 1–0 to claim the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-365" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-365">&#91;360&#93;</a></sup> At the conclusion of the final, Messi was awarded the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" title="FIFA World Cup awards">Golden Ball</a> as the best player of the tournament. In addition to being the joint third-highest goalscorer, with four goals and an assist, he created the most chances, completed the most dribbling runs, made the most deliveries into the penalty area and produced the most throughballs in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Brazil_Technical_Report_and_Statistics_357-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Brazil_Technical_Report_and_Statistics-357">&#91;352&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-366" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-366">&#91;361&#93;</a></sup> However, his selection drew criticism due to his lack of goals in the knockout round; FIFA President <a href="/wiki/Sepp_Blatter" title="Sepp Blatter">Sepp Blatter</a> expressed his surprise, while Maradona suggested that Messi had undeservedly been chosen for marketing purposes.<sup id="cite_ref-367" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-367">&#91;362&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Another final appearance, the third of Messi's senior international career, followed in the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a>, held in Chile. Under the stewardship of former Barcelona manager Gerardo Martino, Argentina entered the tournament as title contenders due to their second-place achievement at the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-368" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-368">&#91;363&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-369" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-369">&#91;364&#93;</a></sup> During the opening match against Paraguay, they were ahead two goals by half-time but lost their lead to end the match in a 2–2 draw; Messi had scored from a penalty kick, netting his only goal in the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-370" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-370">&#91;365&#93;</a></sup> Following a 1–0 win against defending champions Uruguay, Messi earned his <a href="/wiki/List_of_men%27s_footballers_with_100_or_more_international_caps" title="List of men&#39;s footballers with 100 or more international caps">100th cap</a> for his country in the final group match, a 1–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Jamaica_national_football_team" title="Jamaica national football team">Jamaica</a>, becoming only the fifth Argentine to achieve this milestone.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Wins_100th_Argentina_Cap_371-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Wins_100th_Argentina_Cap-371">&#91;366&#93;</a></sup> In his 100 appearances, he had scored a total of 46 goals for Argentina, 22 of which came in official competitive matches.<sup id="cite_ref-Century_of_International_Appearances_326-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Century_of_International_Appearances-326">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi_Wins_100th_Argentina_Cap_371-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_Wins_100th_Argentina_Cap-371">&#91;366&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As Messi evolved from the team's symbolic captain into a genuine leader, he led Argentina to the knockout stage as group winners.<sup id="cite_ref-Even_Hostile_Chile_Fans_Forced_to_Acknowledge_Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Greatness_372-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Even_Hostile_Chile_Fans_Forced_to_Acknowledge_Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Greatness-372">&#91;367&#93;</a></sup> In the quarter-final, they created numerous chances, including a rebound header by Messi, but were repeatedly denied by Colombia's goalkeeper, and ultimately ended the match scoreless, leading to a 5–4 penalty shootout in their favour, with Messi netting his team's first spot kick.<sup id="cite_ref-373" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-373">&#91;368&#93;</a></sup> At the semi-final stage, Messi excelled as playmaker as he provided three assists and helped create three more goals in his side's 6–1 victory over Paraguay, receiving applause from the initially hostile crowd.<sup id="cite_ref-Even_Hostile_Chile_Fans_Forced_to_Acknowledge_Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Greatness_372-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Even_Hostile_Chile_Fans_Forced_to_Acknowledge_Lionel_Messi&#39;s_Greatness-372">&#91;367&#93;</a></sup> Argentina started the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Final" title="2015 Copa América Final">final</a> as the odds-on title favourites, but were defeated by Chile 4–1 in a penalty shootout after an 0–0 extra-time draw. Faced with aggression from opposing players, including taking a boot to the midriff, Messi played below his standards, though he was the only Argentine to successfully convert his penalty.<sup id="cite_ref-374" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-374">&#91;369&#93;</a></sup> At the close of the tournament, he was reportedly selected to receive the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica#Awards" title="2015 Copa América">Most Valuable Player</a> award but rejected the honour.<sup id="cite_ref-Argentina&#39;s_Lionel_Messi_Grateful_for_Support_after_Copa_América_Defeat_375-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Argentina&#39;s_Lionel_Messi_Grateful_for_Support_after_Copa_América_Defeat-375">&#91;370&#93;</a></sup> As Argentina continued a trophy drought that began in 1993, the World Cup and Copa América defeats again brought intense criticism for Messi from Argentine media and fans.<sup id="cite_ref-376" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-376">&#91;371&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2016.E2.80.9317:_Third_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_final.2C_retirement.2C_and_return"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2016–17:_Third_Copa_América_final,_retirement,_and_return">2016–17: Third Copa América final, retirement, and return</span></h3>
<p>Messi's place in Argentina's <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a> squad was initially put in jeopardy when he sustained a back injury in a 1–0 friendly win over <a href="/wiki/Honduras_national_football_team" title="Honduras national football team">Honduras</a> in a pre-Copa América warm-up match on 27 May 2016.<sup id="cite_ref-377" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-377">&#91;372&#93;</a></sup> It was later reported that he had suffered a deep bruise in his lumbar region. He was later left on the bench in Argentina's 2–1 opening win over defending champions Chile on 6 June due to concerns regarding his fitness.<sup id="cite_ref-378" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-378">&#91;373&#93;</a></sup> Although Messi was declared match-fit for his nation's second group match against <a href="/wiki/Panama_national_football_team" title="Panama national football team">Panama</a> on 10 June, Martino left him on the bench once again; he replaced <a href="/wiki/Augusto_Fern%C3%A1ndez" title="Augusto Fernández">Augusto Fernández</a> in the 61st minute and subsequently scored a hat-trick in 19 minutes, also starting the play which led to <a href="/wiki/Sergio_Ag%C3%BCero" title="Sergio Agüero">Sergio Agüero</a>'s goal, as the match ended in a 5–0 victory, sealing Argentina's place in the quarter-finals of the competition;<sup id="cite_ref-379" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-379">&#91;374&#93;</a></sup> he was elected man of the match for his performance.<sup id="cite_ref-MOTM-ARG-PAN_380-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MOTM-ARG-PAN-380">&#91;375&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"Did it annoy me that Messi took the record? A little, yes. You go around the world and people say, 'he's the top scorer for the Argentina national team.' But the advantage I have is that I'm second to an extraterrestrial."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="/wiki/Gabriel_Batistuta" title="Gabriel Batistuta">Gabriel Batistuta</a> on the consolation of Messi breaking his record.<sup id="cite_ref-381" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-381">&#91;376&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>On 18 June 2016, in the quarter-final of the Copa América against Venezuela, Messi produced another man of the match performance,<sup id="cite_ref-MOTM-ARG-VEN_382-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MOTM-ARG-VEN-382">&#91;377&#93;</a></sup> assisting two goals and scoring another in a 4–1 victory, which enabled him to equal Gabriel Batistuta's national record of 54 goals in official international matches.<sup id="cite_ref-383" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-383">&#91;378&#93;</a></sup> This record was broken three days later when Messi scored a free kick in a 4–0 semi-final win against hosts the United States; he also assisted two goals during the match as Argentina sealed a place in the final of the competition for a second consecutive year,<sup id="cite_ref-record_384-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-record-384">&#91;379&#93;</a></sup> and was named man of the match once again.<sup id="cite_ref-MOTM-USA-ARG_385-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MOTM-USA-ARG-385">&#91;380&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During a repeat of the previous year's <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario_Final" title="Copa América Centenario Final">final</a> on 26 June, Argentina once again lost to Chile on penalties after a 0–0 deadlock, resulting in Messi's third consecutive defeat in a major tournament final with Argentina, and his fourth overall. After the match, Messi, who had missed his penalty in the shootout, announced his retirement from international football.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi_retirement_386-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi_retirement-386">&#91;381&#93;</a></sup> He stated, "I tried my hardest. The team has ended for me, a decision made."<sup id="cite_ref-387" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-387">&#91;382&#93;</a></sup> Chile coach <a href="/wiki/Juan_Antonio_Pizzi" title="Juan Antonio Pizzi">Juan Antonio Pizzi</a> said after the match, "My generation can't compare him to Maradona that's for my generation, because of what Maradona did for Argentine football. But I think the best player ever played today here in the United States."<sup id="cite_ref-388" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-388">&#91;383&#93;</a></sup> Messi finished the tournament as the second highest scorer, behind <a href="/wiki/Eduardo_Vargas" title="Eduardo Vargas">Eduardo Vargas</a>, with five goals, and was the highest assist provider with four assists, also winning more <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario_statistics#Man_of_the_Match" title="Copa América Centenario statistics">Man of the Match awards</a> than any other player in the tournament (3);<sup id="cite_ref-conmebol-stats_389-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-conmebol-stats-389">&#91;384&#93;</a></sup> he was named to the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario#Awards" title="Copa América Centenario">team of the tournament</a> for his performances, but missed out on the Golden Ball Award for best player, which went to <a href="/wiki/Alexis_S%C3%A1nchez" title="Alexis Sánchez">Alexis Sánchez</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Copa_América_2016:_Awards_390-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Copa_América_2016:_Awards-390">&#91;385&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id=".22Don.27t_go.2C_Leo.22"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="&quot;Don't_go,_Leo&quot;">"Don't go, Leo"</span></h4>
<p>Following his announcement, a campaign began in Argentina for Messi to change his mind about retiring.<sup id="cite_ref-391" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-391">&#91;386&#93;</a></sup> He was greeted by fans with signs like "Don't go, Leo" when the team landed in <a href="/wiki/Buenos_Aires" title="Buenos Aires">Buenos Aires</a>. <a href="/wiki/President_of_Argentina" title="President of Argentina">President of Argentina</a> <a href="/wiki/Mauricio_Macri" title="Mauricio Macri">Mauricio Macri</a> urged Messi not to quit, stating, "We are lucky, it is one of life's pleasures, it is a gift from God to have the best player in the world in a footballing country like ours... Lionel Messi is the greatest thing we have in Argentina and we must take care of him."<sup id="cite_ref-392" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-392">&#91;387&#93;</a></sup> Mayor of Buenos Aires <a href="/wiki/Horacio_Rodr%C3%ADguez_Larreta" title="Horacio Rodríguez Larreta">Horacio Rodríguez Larreta</a> unveiled a statue of Messi in the capital to convince him to reconsider retirement.<sup id="cite_ref-393" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-393">&#91;388&#93;</a></sup> On social networks, <i>NoTeVayasLeo</i> became a global <a href="/wiki/Trending_topic" class="mw-redirect" title="Trending topic">trending topic</a>, and even a playlist on <a href="/wiki/Spotify" title="Spotify">Spotify</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-394">&#91;389&#93;</a></sup> The campaign also continued in the streets and avenues of the Argentine capital, with about 50,000 supporters going to the <a href="/wiki/Obelisco_de_Buenos_Aires" title="Obelisco de Buenos Aires">Obelisco de Buenos Aires</a> on 2 July, using the same slogan.<sup id="cite_ref-395" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-395">&#91;390&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Return">Return</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"A lot of things went through my mind on the night of the final and I gave serious thought to quitting, but my love for my country and this shirt is too great."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Messi reversing his decision from retiring on 12 August 2016<sup id="cite_ref-396" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-396">&#91;391&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Just a week after Messi announced his international retirement, Argentine newspaper <i><a href="/wiki/La_Naci%C3%B3n" title="La Nación">La Nación</a></i> reported that he was reconsidering playing for Argentina at the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers</a> in September.<sup id="cite_ref-397" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-397">&#91;392&#93;</a></sup> On 12 August, it was confirmed that Messi had reversed his decision to retire from international football, and he was included in the squad for the national team's upcoming 2018 World Cup qualifiers.<sup id="cite_ref-398" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-398">&#91;393&#93;</a></sup> On 1 September 2016, in his first game back, he scored in a 1–0 home win over Uruguay in a 2018 World Cup qualifier.<sup id="cite_ref-399" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-399">&#91;394&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(37594548472).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg/220px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="156" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg/330px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cd/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg/440px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2837594548472%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="909" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(37594548472).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi celebrating scoring a hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a> on 10 October 2017. His goals sent Argentina through to the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a> in Russia.</div></div></div>
<p>On 28 March 2017, Messi was suspended for four international games for insulting an assistant referee in a game against Chile on 23 March 2017. He was also fined CHF 10,000.<sup id="cite_ref-400" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-400">&#91;395&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-401" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-401">&#91;396&#93;</a></sup> On 5 May 2017, Messi's four match ban as well as his 10,000 CHF fine was lifted by <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> after Argentina Football Association appealed against his suspension, which meant he could now play Argentina's remaining World Cup Qualifiers.<sup id="cite_ref-402" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-402">&#91;397&#93;</a></sup> Argentina's place in the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 World Cup</a> was in jeopardy going into their final qualifying match as they were sixth in their group, outside the five possible CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying spots, meaning they risked failing to qualify for the World Cup for the first time since 1970. On 10 October 2017, Messi led his country to World Cup qualification in scoring a hat-trick as Argentina came from behind to defeat <a href="/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a> 3–1 away; Argentina had not defeated Ecuador in <a href="/wiki/Quito" title="Quito">Quito</a> since 2001.<sup id="cite_ref-Guardian_2017_403-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian_2017-403">&#91;398&#93;</a></sup> Messi's three goals saw him become the joint all-time leading scorer in CONMEBOL World Cup qualifiers with 21 goals, alongside Uruguay's <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>, overtaking the previous record which was held by compatriot <a href="/wiki/Hern%C3%A1n_Crespo" title="Hernán Crespo">Hernán Crespo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Guardian_2017_403-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian_2017-403">&#91;398&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2018:_World_Cup">2018: World Cup</span></h3>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"The squad is the worst in their history. Even having the best player in the world was not capable of creating a competitive team. All the decline of recent times was hidden by this unrivalled genius [Messi]"</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Former Argentine player <a href="/wiki/Osvaldo_Ardiles" title="Osvaldo Ardiles">Osvaldo Ardiles</a> on the decline in quality of Argentina being masked by Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-404" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-404">&#91;399&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Following on from their poor qualification campaign, salvaged by Messi, expectations were not high going into the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 World Cup</a>, with the team, without an injured Messi, losing 6–1 to Spain in March 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-405" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-405">&#91;400&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-406" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-406">&#91;401&#93;</a></sup> Prior to Argentina's opener, there was speculation in the media over whether this would be Messi's final World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-407" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-407">&#91;402&#93;</a></sup> In the team's opening group match against <a href="/wiki/Iceland_national_football_team" title="Iceland national football team">Iceland</a> on 16 June, Messi missed a potential match-winning penalty in an eventual 1–1 draw.<sup id="cite_ref-408" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-408">&#91;403&#93;</a></sup> In Argentina's second game of the 2018 World Cup on 21 June, the team lost 3–0 to <a href="/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a>. Post match the Argentina coach <a href="/wiki/Jorge_Sampaoli" title="Jorge Sampaoli">Jorge Sampaoli</a> spoke of the lack of quality in the team surrounding Messi, "the reality of the Argentina squad clouds his [Messi's] brilliance".<sup id="cite_ref-Sampaoli_409-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Sampaoli-409">&#91;404&#93;</a></sup> Messi had just 49 touches of the ball and only two inside the Croatia penalty area.<sup id="cite_ref-Trinuna_410-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Trinuna-410">&#91;405&#93;</a></sup> Sampaoli stated, "we quite simply couldn't pass to him to help him generate the situations he is used to. We worked to give him the ball but the opponent also worked hard to prevent him from getting the ball. We lost that battle."<sup id="cite_ref-Sampaoli_409-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Sampaoli-409">&#91;404&#93;</a></sup> Croatia midfielder <a href="/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87" title="Luka Modri">Luka Modri</a> also stated post match, "Messi is an incredible player but he can't do everything alone."<sup id="cite_ref-Trinuna_410-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Trinuna-410">&#91;405&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg/220px-Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="151" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg/330px-Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/15/Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg/440px-Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1400" data-file-height="964" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_vs_Nigeria1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi celebrating a goal against <a href="/wiki/Nigeria_national_football_team" title="Nigeria national football team">Nigeria</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>In Argentina's final group match against Nigeria at the <a href="/wiki/Krestovsky_Stadium" title="Krestovsky Stadium">Krestovsky Stadium</a>, Saint Petersburg on 26 June, Messi scored the opening goal in an eventual 2–1 victory, becoming the third Argentine after Diego Maradona and Gabriel Batistuta to score in three different World Cups; he also became the first player to score in the World Cup in his teens, twenties, and his thirties.<sup id="cite_ref-411" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-411">&#91;406&#93;</a></sup> A goal of the tournament contender, Messi received a long pass from midfield and controlled the ball on the run with two touches before striking it across goal into the net with his weaker right foot.<sup id="cite_ref-412" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-412">&#91;407&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-413" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-413">&#91;408&#93;</a></sup> Argentina progressed to the second round as group runners-up behind Croatia.<sup id="cite_ref-414" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-414">&#91;409&#93;</a></sup> In the round of 16 match against eventual champions <a href="/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team">France</a> on 30 June, Messi set up <a href="/wiki/Gabriel_Mercado" title="Gabriel Mercado">Gabriel Mercado</a>'s and Sergio Agüero's goals in a 4–3 defeat, which saw Argentina eliminated from the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-415" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-415">&#91;410&#93;</a></sup> With his two assists in his team's second round fixture, Messi became the first player to provide an assist in the last four World Cups, and also became the first player to provide two assists in a match for Argentina since Diego Maradona had managed the same feat against South Korea in 1986.<sup id="cite_ref-416" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-416">&#91;411&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-417" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-417">&#91;412&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Following the tournament, Messi stated that he would not participate in Argentina's friendlies against Guatemala and Colombia in September 2018, and commented that it would be unlikely that he would represent his nation for the remainder of the calendar year. Messi's absence from the national team and his continued failure to win a title with Argentina prompted speculation in the media that Messi might retire from international football once again.<sup id="cite_ref-418" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-418">&#91;413&#93;</a></sup> In March 2019, however, he was called up to the Argentina squad once again for the team's friendlies against Venezuela and <a href="/wiki/Morocco_national_football_team" title="Morocco national football team">Morocco</a> later that month.<sup id="cite_ref-419" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-419">&#91;414&#93;</a></sup> He made his international return on 22 March, in a 3–1 friendly defeat to Venezuela, in Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-420" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-420">&#91;415&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2019.E2.80.93present:_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica_third-place"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2019–present:_Copa_América_third-place">2019–present: Copa América third-place</span></h3>
<p>On 21 May 2019, Messi was included in <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Scaloni" title="Lionel Scaloni">Lionel Scaloni</a>'s final 23-man Argentina squad for the <a href="/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-421" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-421">&#91;416&#93;</a></sup> In Argentina's second group match of the tournament on 19 June, Messi scored the equalising goal from the penalty spot in a 1–1 draw against Paraguay.<sup id="cite_ref-422" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-422">&#91;417&#93;</a></sup> After coming under criticism in the media over his performance following Argentina's 2–0 victory over Venezuela in the quarter-finals at the Maracanã Stadium on 28 June, Messi commented that it had not been his best Copa América, while also criticising the poor quality of the pitches.<sup id="cite_ref-423" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-423">&#91;418&#93;</a></sup> Following Argentina's 2–0 defeat to hosts Brazil in the semi-finals on 2 July, Messi was critical of the refereeing during the match.<sup id="cite_ref-424" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-424">&#91;419&#93;</a></sup> In the third-place match against Chile on 6 July, Messi set-up Agüero's opening goal from a free kick in an eventual 2–1 win, to help Argentina capture the bronze medal; however, he was sent off along with <a href="/wiki/Gary_Medel" title="Gary Medel">Gary Medel</a> in the 37th minute of play, after being involved in an altercation with the Chilean.<sup id="cite_ref-425" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-425">&#91;420&#93;</a></sup> Following the match, Messi refused to collect his medal, and implied in a post-match interview that his comments following the semi-final led to his sending off.<sup id="cite_ref-426" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-426">&#91;421&#93;</a></sup> Messi later issued an apology for his comments, but was fined $1,500 and was handed a one-match ban by CONMEBOL, which ruled him out of Argentina's next <a href="/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">World Cup qualifier</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-427" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-427">&#91;422&#93;</a></sup> On 2 August, Messi was banned for three months from international football and was fined $50,000 by CONMEBOL for his comments against the referee's decisions; this ban meant he would miss Argentina's friendly matches against Chile, Mexico and Germany in September and October.<sup id="cite_ref-428" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-428">&#91;423&#93;</a></sup> 
</p><p>On 10 September 2020, Argentina FA announced that Messi's one match suspension was lifted and he would be available to play the qualifiers next month.<sup id="cite_ref-429" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-429">&#91;424&#93;</a></sup> On 18 September, Messi was called up to the Argentina squad for the <a href="/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">World Cup qualifiers</a> against Ecuador and Bolivia in October.<sup id="cite_ref-430" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-430">&#91;425&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Player_profile">Player profile</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Style_of_play">Style of play</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:173px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_(cropped)_Messi.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_%28cropped%29_Messi.jpg/171px-Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_%28cropped%29_Messi.jpg" decoding="async" width="171" height="302" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/0e/Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_%28cropped%29_Messi.jpg 1.5x" data-file-width="183" data-file-height="322" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Argentina_team_in_St._Petersburg_(cropped)_Messi.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A versatile forward, Messi has often been deployed in the classic <a href="/wiki/Midfielder#Attacking_midfielder" title="Midfielder">number 10 position</a></div></div></div>
<p>Due to his short stature, Messi has a lower centre of gravity than taller players, which gives him greater agility, allowing him to change direction more quickly and evade opposing tackles;<sup id="cite_ref-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era_431-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era-431">&#91;426&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World_432-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World-432">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup> this has led the Spanish media to dub him <i>La Pulga Atómica</i> ("The Atomic Flea").<sup id="cite_ref-433" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-433">&#91;428&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-434" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-434">&#91;429&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-435" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-435">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup> Despite being physically unimposing, he possesses significant upper-body strength, which, combined with his low centre of gravity and resulting balance, aids him in withstanding physical challenges from opponents; he has consequently been noted for his lack of <a href="/wiki/Diving_(association_football)" title="Diving (association football)">diving</a> in a sport rife with playacting.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World_432-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World-432">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player_436-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player-436">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup> His short, strong legs allow him to excel in short bursts of acceleration while his quick feet enable him to retain control of the ball when <a href="/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbling</a> at speed.<sup id="cite_ref-437" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-437">&#91;432&#93;</a></sup> His former Barcelona manager Pep Guardiola once stated, "Messi is the only player that runs faster with the ball than he does without it."<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)_51-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)-51">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> Although he has improved his ability with his weaker foot since his mid-20s, Messi is predominantly a left-footed player; with the outside of his left foot, he usually begins dribbling runs, while he uses the inside of his foot to finish and provide passes and <a href="/wiki/Assist_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Assist (football)">assists</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013553_438-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013553-438">&#91;433&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Control,_Stroke_and_Touch_on_the_Ball:_Because_in_Football_Small_Is_Beautiful_439-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Control,_Stroke_and_Touch_on_the_Ball:_Because_in_Football_Small_Is_Beautiful-439">&#91;434&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg/220px-Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg/330px-Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg/440px-Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3580" data-file-height="2685" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Germany_and_Argentina_face_off_in_the_final_of_the_World_Cup_2014_04_crop.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi preparing to shoot with his dominant left foot during the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Final" title="2014 FIFA World Cup Final">final</a> of the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>A prolific goalscorer, Messi is known for his finishing, positioning, quick reactions, and ability to make attacking runs to beat the defensive line. He also functions in a <a href="/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmaking</a>  role, courtesy of his vision and range of passing. He has often been described as a conjurer, creating goals and opportunities where seemingly none exist.<sup id="cite_ref-440" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-440">&#91;435&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-441" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-441">&#91;436&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-442" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-442">&#91;437&#93;</a></sup> Moreover, he is an accurate <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free kick</a> and <a href="/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football)" title="Penalty kick (association football)">penalty kick</a> taker.<sup id="cite_ref-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World_432-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World-432">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Six_Reasons_Why_Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_443-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Six_Reasons_Why_Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best-443">&#91;438&#93;</a></sup> With his conversion rate from his <a href="/wiki/Curl_(association_football)" title="Curl (association football)">bending</a> free kicks increasing over time Messi has developed into one of the best free kick exponents in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-444" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-444">&#91;439&#93;</a></sup>
