</p><p>Messi's pace and technical ability enable him to undertake individual dribbling runs towards goal, in particular during counterattacks, usually starting from the halfway line or the right side of the pitch.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era_431-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era-431">&#91;426&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player_436-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player-436">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Six_Reasons_Why_Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best_443-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Six_Reasons_Why_Lionel_Messi_Is_the_World&#39;s_Best-443">&#91;438&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Loose_Vuvuzela_445-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Loose_Vuvuzela-445">&#91;440&#93;</a></sup> Widely considered to be the best dribbler in the world,<sup id="cite_ref-446" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-446">&#91;441&#93;</a></sup> and one of the greatest of all time,<sup id="cite_ref-447" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-447">&#91;442&#93;</a></sup> with regard to this ability, his former Argentina manager Diego Maradona has said of him, "The ball stays glued to his foot; I've seen great players in my career, but I've never seen anyone with Messi's ball control."<sup id="cite_ref-Control,_Stroke_and_Touch_on_the_Ball:_Because_in_Football_Small_Is_Beautiful_439-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Control,_Stroke_and_Touch_on_the_Ball:_Because_in_Football_Small_Is_Beautiful-439">&#91;434&#93;</a></sup> Beyond his individual qualities, he is also a well-rounded, hard-working team player, known for his creative combinations, in particular with former Barcelona midfielders <a href="/wiki/Xavi" title="Xavi">Xavi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era_431-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Golden_Yell:_Ronaldo_and_Messi_Battle_to_Define_a_Football_Era-431">&#91;426&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World_432-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Five_Reasons_Why_Messi_Stands_out_in_Soccer_World-432">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:232px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year,_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg/230px-Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="230" height="210" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg/345px-Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/78/Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg/460px-Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year%2C_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3080" data-file-height="2811" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Lionel_Messi_Player_of_the_Year,_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi is known for dropping deep, linking-up with midfielders, orchestrating his teams attacking plays, and creating chances for other players</div></div></div>
<p>Tactically, Messi plays in a free attacking role; a versatile player, he is capable of attacking on either wing or through the centre of the pitch. His favoured position in childhood was the playmaker behind two strikers, known as the <i>enganche</i> in Argentine football, but he began his career in Spain as a <a href="/wiki/Association_football_positions#Winger" title="Association football positions">left-winger</a> or <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Second_striker" title="Forward (association football)">left-sided forward</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013155–156,_405–406_347-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013155–156,_405–406-347">&#91;342&#93;</a></sup> Upon his first-team debut, he was moved onto the right wing by manager <a href="/wiki/Frank_Rijkaard" title="Frank Rijkaard">Frank Rijkaard</a>; from this position, he could more easily cut through the defence into the middle of the pitch and <a href="/wiki/Curl_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Curl (football)">curl</a> shots on goal with his left foot, rather than predominantly <a href="/wiki/Cross_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Cross (football)">cross</a> balls for teammates.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)_51-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_(FT_Magazine)-51">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> Under Guardiola and subsequent managers, he most often played in a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#False_9" title="Forward (association football)">false nine</a> role; positioned as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Centre-forward" title="Forward (association football)">centre-forward</a> or lone <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)#Striker" title="Forward (association football)">striker</a>, he would roam the centre, often moving deep into midfield and drawing defenders with him, in order to create and exploit spaces for passes, other teammates' attacking runs off the ball, Messi's own dribbling runs, or combinations with Xavi and Iniesta.<sup id="cite_ref-Boy_Genius_29-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Boy_Genius-29">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup> Under the stewardship of Luis Enrique, Messi initially returned to playing in the right-sided position that characterised much of his early career in the manager's 4–3–3 formation,<sup id="cite_ref-Motivated_Lionel_Messi_Transforms_Barcelona&#39;s_Hopes_for_Trophy_Treble_179-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Motivated_Lionel_Messi_Transforms_Barcelona&#39;s_Hopes_for_Trophy_Treble-179">&#91;175&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-448" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-448">&#91;443&#93;</a></sup> while he was increasingly deployed in a deeper, free playmaking role in later seasons.<sup id="cite_ref-449" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-449">&#91;444&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-improvement_450-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-improvement-450">&#91;445&#93;</a></sup> Under manager <a href="/wiki/Ernesto_Valverde" title="Ernesto Valverde">Ernesto Valverde</a>, Messi played in a variety of roles. While he occasionally continued to be deployed in a deeper role, from which he could make runs from behind into the box,<sup id="cite_ref-451" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-451">&#91;446&#93;</a></sup> or even on the right wing<sup id="cite_ref-452" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-452">&#91;447&#93;</a></sup> or as a false nine,<sup id="cite_ref-453" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-453">&#91;448&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-454" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-454">&#91;449&#93;</a></sup> he was also used in a more offensive, central role in a 4–2–3–1,<sup id="cite_ref-improvement_450-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-improvement-450">&#91;445&#93;</a></sup> or as a second striker in a 4–4–2 formation, where he was once again given the licence to drop deep, link-up with midfielders, orchestrate his teams attacking plays, and create chances for his attacking partner Suárez.<sup id="cite_ref-455" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-455">&#91;450&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-456" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-456">&#91;451&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>As his career advanced, and his tendency to dribble diminished slightly with age, Messi began to dictate play in <a href="/wiki/Midfielder#Deep-lying_playmaker" title="Midfielder">deeper areas of the pitch</a>, and developed into one of the best passers and playmakers in football history.<sup id="cite_ref-457" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-457">&#91;452&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-458" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-458">&#91;453&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-459" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-459">&#91;454&#93;</a></sup> His work-rate off the ball and defensive responsibilities also decreased as his career progressed; by covering less ground on the pitch, and instead conserving his energy for short bursts of speed, he was able to improve his efficiency, movement, and positional play, and was also able to avoid muscular injuries, despite often playing a large number of matches throughout a particular season on a consistent basis. Indeed, while he was injury-prone in his early career, he was later able to improve his injury record by running less off the ball, and by adopting a stricter diet, training regime, and sleep schedule.<sup id="cite_ref-460" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-460">&#91;455&#93;</a></sup> With the Argentina national team, Messi has similarly played anywhere along the frontline; under various managers, he has been employed on the right wing, as a false nine, as an out-and-out striker, in a supporting role alongside another forward, or in a deeper, free creative role as a classic number 10 playmaker or <a href="/wiki/Midfielder#Attacking_midfielder" title="Midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> behind the strikers.<sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi_Showing_Some_Promising_Signs_in_a_New_Argentina_Role_352-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi_Showing_Some_Promising_Signs_in_a_New_Argentina_Role-352">&#91;347&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-461" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-461">&#91;456&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Reception">Reception</span></h3>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"I have seen the player who will inherit my place in Argentinian football and his name is Messi."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a> hailing the 18-year-old Messi as his <a href="/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">successor</a> in February 2006<sup id="cite_ref-Maradona_Hails_His_Successor_73-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Maradona_Hails_His_Successor-73">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div><p>A prodigious talent as a teenager, Messi established himself among the world's best players before age 20.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best_66-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_I&#39;m_Not_the_Best-66">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup> Diego Maradona considered the 18-year-old Messi the best player in the world alongside <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>, while the Brazilian himself, shortly after winning the <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>, commented, "I'm not even the best at Barça", in reference to his protégé.<sup id="cite_ref-462" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-462">&#91;457&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-463" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-463">&#91;458&#93;</a></sup> Four years later, after Messi had won his first Ballon d'Or by a record margin,<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524_80-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013519–524-80">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup> the public debate regarding his qualities as a player moved beyond his status in contemporary football to the possibility that he was one of the greatest players in history.<sup id="cite_ref-Magic_in_His_Feet_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Magic_in_His_Feet-18">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player_436-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Arsenal_v_Barcelona:_Lionel_Messi_Making_Case_for_World&#39;s_Greatest_Ever_Player-436">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-464" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-464">&#91;459&#93;</a></sup> An early proponent was his then-manager Pep Guardiola, who, as early as August 2009, declared Messi to be the best player he had ever seen.<sup id="cite_ref-465" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-465">&#91;460&#93;</a></sup> In the following years, this opinion gained greater acceptance among pundits, managers, former and current players,<sup id="cite_ref-Is_Sublime_Lionel_Messi_the_Greatest_Footballer_Ever?_121-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Is_Sublime_Lionel_Messi_the_Greatest_Footballer_Ever?-121">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-466" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-466">&#91;461&#93;</a></sup> and by the end of Barça's second treble-winning season, Messi's superiority, ahead of Maradona and <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a>, had become the apparent view among many fans and pundits in continental Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-Telegraph_2016_467-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Telegraph_2016-467">&#91;462&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Lionel_Messi:_Is_the_Barcelona_Forward_the_Greatest_of_Them_All?_468-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lionel_Messi:_Is_the_Barcelona_Forward_the_Greatest_of_Them_All?-468">&#91;463&#93;</a></sup> A frequent dismissal, however, has centred on the fact that Messi has not won the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> or any other major trophy with Argentina, leading the majority in the sport to instead cite him as arguably the best club player in history.<sup id="cite_ref-469" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-469">&#91;464&#93;</a></sup>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{display:flex;flex-direction:column}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{display:flex;flex-direction:row;clear:left;flex-wrap:wrap;width:100%;box-sizing:border-box}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{margin:1px;float:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .theader{clear:both;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;align-self:center;background-color:transparent;width:100%}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbcaption{background-color:transparent}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-left{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-right{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .text-align-center{text-align:center}@media all and (max-width:720px){.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;max-width:none!important;align-items:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow{justify-content:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle{float:none!important;max-width:100%!important;box-sizing:border-box;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .tsingle .thumbcaption{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .tmulti .trow>.thumbcaption{text-align:center}}</style></p><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:254px;max-width:254px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:252px;max-width:252px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_Maradona.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Messi_Maradona.jpg/250px-Messi_Maradona.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="167" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Messi_Maradona.jpg/375px-Messi_Maradona.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Messi_Maradona.jpg/500px-Messi_Maradona.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1500" data-file-height="1000" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption">Argentina fans with Messi and Maradona banners at the <a href="/wiki/2018_World_Cup" class="mw-redirect" title="2018 World Cup">2018 World Cup</a> in Russia</div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:252px;max-width:252px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg/250px-Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="86" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg/375px-Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg/500px-Maradona_messi_creacion_adan.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1486" data-file-height="510" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption"><i>The Sistine Chapel of Football</i> painting (Messi to the left, Maradona to the right), on the ceiling of a sports club, Sportivo Pereyra, in <a href="/wiki/Barracas,_Buenos_Aires" title="Barracas, Buenos Aires">Barracas, Buenos Aires</a></div></div></div></div></div>
<p>Throughout his career, Messi has been compared with his late compatriot Diego Maradona, due to their similar playing styles as diminutive, left-footed dribblers. Initially, he was merely one of many young Argentine players, including his boyhood idol <a href="/wiki/Pablo_Aimar" title="Pablo Aimar">Pablo Aimar</a>, to receive the "<a href="/wiki/New_Maradona" title="New Maradona">New Maradona</a>" moniker, but as his career progressed, Messi proved his similarity beyond all previous contenders, establishing himself as the greatest player Argentina had produced since Maradona.<sup id="cite_ref-Pablo_Aimar:_The_Argentinian_Wizard_Admired_by_Maradona_and_Messi_26-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pablo_Aimar:_The_Argentinian_Wizard_Admired_by_Maradona_and_Messi-26">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539_345-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELisi2011533–539-345">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Jorge_Valdano" title="Jorge Valdano">Jorge Valdano</a>, who won the <a href="/wiki/1986_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1986 FIFA World Cup">1986 World Cup</a> alongside Maradona, said in October 2013, "Messi is Maradona every day. For the last five years, Messi has been the Maradona of the World Cup in Mexico."<sup id="cite_ref-470" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-470">&#91;465&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Menotti" class="mw-redirect" title="César Menotti">César Menotti</a>, who as manager orchestrated their <a href="/wiki/1978_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1978 FIFA World Cup">1978 World Cup</a> victory, echoed this sentiment when he opined that Messi plays "at the level of the best Maradona".<sup id="cite_ref-471" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-471">&#91;466&#93;</a></sup> Other notable Argentines in the sport, such as <a href="/wiki/Osvaldo_Ardiles" title="Osvaldo Ardiles">Osvaldo Ardiles</a>, <a href="/wiki/Javier_Zanetti" title="Javier Zanetti">Javier Zanetti</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Diego_Simeone" title="Diego Simeone">Diego Simeone</a>, have expressed their belief that Messi has overtaken Maradona as the best player in history.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHunter20127–8_472-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEHunter20127–8-472">&#91;467&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-473" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-473">&#91;468&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-474" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-474">&#91;469&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In Argentine society, Messi is generally held in lesser esteem than Maradona, a consequence of not only his perceived uneven performances with the national team, but also of differences in class, personality, and background. Messi is in some ways the antithesis of his predecessor: where Maradona was an extroverted, controversial character who rose to greatness from the slums, Messi is reserved and unassuming, an unremarkable man outside of football.<sup id="cite_ref-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi_318-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi-318">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-475" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-475">&#91;470&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-476" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-476">&#91;471&#93;</a></sup> An enduring mark against him is the fact that, through no fault of his own, he never proved himself in the <a href="/wiki/Argentine_Primera_Divisi%C3%B3n" title="Argentine Primera División">Argentine Primera División</a> as an upcoming player, achieving stardom overseas from a young age,<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi_318-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_Burden_of_Being_Messi-318">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup> while his lack of outward passion for the <i>Albiceleste</i> shirt (he does not sing the national anthem and is disinclined to emotional displays) have in the past led to the false perception that he felt Catalan rather than truly Argentine.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420_351-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013414–420-351">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup> Despite having lived in Spain since age 13, Messi has said: "Argentina is my country, my family, my way of expressing myself. I would change all my records to make the people in my country happy."<sup id="cite_ref-477" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-477">&#91;472&#93;</a></sup> Moreover, several pundits and footballing figures, including Maradona, have also questioned Messi's leadership with Argentina at times, despite his playing ability.<sup id="cite_ref-478" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-478">&#91;473&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-479" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-479">&#91;474&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-480" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-480">&#91;475&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Comparisons_to_Cristiano_Ronaldo">Comparisons to Cristiano Ronaldo</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">Messi–Ronaldo rivalry</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/170px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/255px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg/340px-Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina%2C_9th_February_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2115" data-file-height="2820" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristiano_Ronaldo_and_Lionel_Messi_-_Portugal_vs_Argentina,_9th_February_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi has been compared to <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> (left) throughout much of their careers</div></div></div>
<p>Among his contemporary peers, Messi is most often compared and contrasted with Portuguese forward <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>, as part of an <a href="/wiki/Messi%E2%80%93Ronaldo_rivalry" title="Messi–Ronaldo rivalry">ongoing rivalry</a> that has been compared to <a href="/wiki/List_of_sports_rivalries" title="List of sports rivalries">past sports rivalries</a> like the <a href="/wiki/Muhammad_Ali" title="Muhammad Ali">Muhammad Ali</a>–<a href="/wiki/Joe_Frazier" title="Joe Frazier">Joe Frazier</a> rivalry in boxing, the <a href="/wiki/Bj%C3%B6rn_Borg" title="Björn Borg">Björn Borg</a>–<a href="/wiki/John_McEnroe" title="John McEnroe">John McEnroe</a> <a href="/wiki/Borg%E2%80%93McEnroe_rivalry" title="Borg–McEnroe rivalry">rivalry</a> in tennis, and the <a href="/wiki/Ayrton_Senna" title="Ayrton Senna">Ayrton Senna</a>–<a href="/wiki/Alain_Prost" title="Alain Prost">Alain Prost</a> rivalry from Formula One motor racing.<sup id="cite_ref-481" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-481">&#91;476&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-482" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-482">&#91;477&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Although Messi has at times denied any rivalry,<sup id="cite_ref-483" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-483">&#91;478&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-484" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-484">&#91;479&#93;</a></sup> they are widely believed to push one another in their aim to be the best player in the world:<sup id="cite_ref-Real_Madrid_v_Barcelona:_Has_Ronaldo_Overtaken_Messi?_167-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Real_Madrid_v_Barcelona:_Has_Ronaldo_Overtaken_Messi?-167">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup> since 2008, Messi has won six Ballons d'Or to Ronaldo's five,<sup id="cite_ref-485" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-485">&#91;480&#93;</a></sup> six FIFA World's Best Player awards to Ronaldo's five, and six <a href="/wiki/European_Golden_Shoe" title="European Golden Shoe">European Golden Shoes</a> to Ronaldo's four.<sup id="cite_ref-486" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-486">&#91;481&#93;</a></sup> Pundits and fans regularly argue the individual merits of both players;<sup id="cite_ref-Real_Madrid_v_Barcelona:_Has_Ronaldo_Overtaken_Messi?_167-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Real_Madrid_v_Barcelona:_Has_Ronaldo_Overtaken_Messi?-167">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-487" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-487">&#91;482&#93;</a></sup> beyond their playing styles, the debate also revolves around their differing physiques – Ronaldo is 1.87&#160;m (6&#160;ft <span class="frac nowrap">1<span class="visualhide">&#160;</span><sup>1</sup>&#8260;<sub>2</sub></span>&#160;in) with a muscular build – and contrasting public personalities, with Ronaldo's self-confidence and theatrics a foil to Messi's humility.<sup id="cite_ref-488" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-488">&#91;483&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-489" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-489">&#91;484&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Cristiano_Ronaldo:_He&#39;s_Got_a_God-Given_Talent_–_and_He_Knows_It_490-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Cristiano_Ronaldo:_He&#39;s_Got_a_God-Given_Talent_–_and_He_Knows_It-490">&#91;485&#93;</a></sup> From 2009–10 to 2017–18, Messi faced Ronaldo at least twice every season in <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i>, which ranks among the world's most viewed annual sports events.<sup id="cite_ref-50million_491-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50million-491">&#91;486&#93;</a></sup> Off the pitch, Ronaldo is his direct competitor in terms of salary, sponsorships, and social media fanbase.<sup id="cite_ref-50million_491-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50million-491">&#91;486&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="In_popular_culture">In popular culture</span></h2>
<p>According to <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i>, Messi was the world's highest-paid footballer for five years out of six between 2009 and 2014; he was the first player to exceed the €40&#160;million benchmark, with earnings of €41&#160;million in 2013, and the €50–€60&#160;million points, with income of €65&#160;million in 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-Messi,_the_(Very)_Good_Payroll_172-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi,_the_(Very)_Good_Payroll-172">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-492" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-492">&#91;487&#93;</a></sup> Messi was second on <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> list of the world's highest-paid athletes (after Cristiano Ronaldo) with income of $81.4&#160;million from his salary and endorsements in 2015–16.<sup id="cite_ref-493" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-493">&#91;488&#93;</a></sup> In 2018 he was the first player to exceed the €100m benchmark for a calendar year, with earnings of €126m ($154m) in combined income from salaries, bonuses and endorsements.<sup id="cite_ref-494" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-494">&#91;489&#93;</a></sup> <i>Forbes</i> ranked him the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's highest-paid athlete</a> in 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-495" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-495">&#91;490&#93;</a></sup> Since 2008, he has been Barcelona's highest-paid player, receiving a salary that increased incrementally from €7.8&#160;million to €13&#160;million over the next five years.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472_86-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013472-86">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Messi:_Amazing_Talent_in_a_Reluctant_Star_87-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Messi:_Amazing_Talent_in_a_Reluctant_Star-87">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013556_153-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013556-153">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup> Signing a new Barcelona contract in 2017, he earns $667,000 per week in wages, and Barcelona also paid him $59.6&#160;million as a signing on bonus.<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_2017_496-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes_2017-496">&#91;491&#93;</a></sup> His buyout clause is set at $835&#160;million (€700&#160;million).<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_2017_496-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes_2017-496">&#91;491&#93;</a></sup> In 2020, Messi became the second footballer (and second athlete in a team sport), after Cristiano Ronaldo, to surpass $1 billion in earnings during their careers.<sup id="cite_ref-Career_billion_15-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Career_billion-15">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:242px;"><a href="/wiki/File:What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6c/What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg/240px-What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg" decoding="async" width="240" height="180" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6c/What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg/360px-What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6c/What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg/480px-What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2816" data-file-height="2112" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:What_a_Messi_-_panoramio.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Billboard of Messi in <a href="/wiki/Taipei" title="Taipei">Taipei</a>, Taiwan promoting <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Airlines" title="Turkish Airlines">Turkish Airlines</a></div></div></div>
<p>In addition to his salary and bonuses, much of his income derives from endorsements; <i><a href="/wiki/SportsPro" title="SportsPro">SportsPro</a></i> has consequently cited him as one of the world's most marketable athletes every year since their research began in 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-497" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-497">&#91;492&#93;</a></sup> His main sponsor since 2006 is the sportswear company <a href="/wiki/Adidas" title="Adidas">Adidas</a>. As Barcelona's leading youth prospect, he had been signed with <a href="/wiki/Nike,_Inc." title="Nike, Inc.">Nike</a> since age 14, but transferred to Adidas after they successfully challenged their rival's claim to his image rights in court.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli201294–97_498-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli201294–97-498">&#91;493&#93;</a></sup> Over time, Messi established himself as their leading brand endorser;<sup id="cite_ref-50million_491-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50million-491">&#91;486&#93;</a></sup> from 2008, he had a long-running signature collection of Adidas F50 boots, and in 2015, he became the first footballer to receive his own sub-brand of Adidas boots, the Adidas Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-499" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-499">&#91;494&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-500" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-500">&#91;495&#93;</a></sup> Since 2017, Messi has worn the latest version of the Adidas Nemeziz.<sup id="cite_ref-501" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-501">&#91;496&#93;</a></sup> In 2015, a Barcelona jersey with Messi's name and number (Messi, 10) was the best-selling replica jersey worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-502" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-502">&#91;497&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(36956136633).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg/220px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="153" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg/330px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg/440px-ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_%2836956136633%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1021" data-file-height="712" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:ECUADOR_VS_ARGENTINA_(36956136633).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>After <a href="/wiki/Sign_of_the_cross#Use" title="Sign of the cross">blessing himself</a>, Messi often <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">celebrates a goal</a> by pointing a finger on each hand towards <a href="/wiki/Heaven" title="Heaven">the sky</a> in dedication to his late grandmother.<sup id="cite_ref-Dedication_503-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Dedication-503">&#91;498&#93;</a></sup> His goal celebration features in the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)"><i>FIFA</i> video game series</a>, first appearing in <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_14" title="FIFA 14">FIFA 14</a></i></div></div></div>
<p>As a commercial entity, Messi's marketing brand has been based exclusively on his talents and achievements as a player, in contrast to arguably more glamorous players like Cristiano Ronaldo and <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a>. At the start of his career, he thus mainly held sponsorship contracts with companies that employ sports-oriented marketing, such as Adidas, <a href="/wiki/Pepsi" title="Pepsi">Pepsi</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Konami" title="Konami">Konami</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-The_World&#39;s_Fourth_Most_Marketable_Athlete_–_Lionel_Messi_504-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_World&#39;s_Fourth_Most_Marketable_Athlete_–_Lionel_Messi-504">&#91;499&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-505" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-505">&#91;500&#93;</a></sup> From 2010 onwards, concurrently with his increased achievements as a player, his marketing appeal widened, leading to long-term endorsement deals with luxury brands <a href="/wiki/Dolce_%26_Gabbana" title="Dolce &amp; Gabbana">Dolce &amp; Gabbana</a> and <a href="/wiki/Audemars_Piguet" title="Audemars Piguet">Audemars Piguet</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-The_World&#39;s_Fourth_Most_Marketable_Athlete_–_Lionel_Messi_504-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-The_World&#39;s_Fourth_Most_Marketable_Athlete_–_Lionel_Messi-504">&#91;499&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-506" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-506">&#91;501&#93;</a></sup> Messi is also a global brand ambassador for <a href="/wiki/Gillette_(brand)" class="mw-redirect" title="Gillette (brand)">Gillette</a>, <a href="/wiki/Turkish_Airlines" title="Turkish Airlines">Turkish Airlines</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ooredoo" title="Ooredoo">Ooredoo</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Tata_Motors" title="Tata Motors">Tata Motors</a>, among other companies.<sup id="cite_ref-507" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-507">&#91;502&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-508" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-508">&#91;503&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-509" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-509">&#91;504&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-510" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-510">&#91;505&#93;</a></sup> Additionally, Messi was the face of Konami's video game series <i><a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer" title="Pro Evolution Soccer">Pro Evolution Soccer</a></i>, appearing on the covers of <i><a href="/wiki/PES_2009" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2009">PES 2009</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/PES_2010" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2010">PES 2010</a>,</i> <i><a href="/wiki/PES_2011" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2011">PES 2011</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/PES_2020" class="mw-redirect" title="PES 2020">PES 2020</a></i>. He subsequently signed with rival company <a href="/wiki/EA_Sports" title="EA Sports">EA Sports</a> to become the face of their series <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)">FIFA</a></i> and has since appeared on four consecutive covers from <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_13" title="FIFA 13">FIFA 13</a></i> to <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_16" title="FIFA 16">FIFA 16</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGuinness_World_Records2014102_511-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGuinness_World_Records2014102-511">&#91;506&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-512" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-512">&#91;507&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_car.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Messi_car.jpg/220px-Messi_car.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Messi_car.jpg/330px-Messi_car.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Messi_car.jpg/440px-Messi_car.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3264" data-file-height="2448" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_car.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Fans of Messi in India decorated this vehicle</div></div></div>
<p>Messi's global popularity and influence are well documented. He was among the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100"><i>Time</i> 100</a>, an annual list of the world's most influential people as published by <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i>, in 2011 and 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-513" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-513">&#91;508&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-514" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-514">&#91;509&#93;</a></sup> His fanbase on the social media website Facebook is among the largest of all public figures: within seven hours of its launch in April 2011, Messi's Facebook page had nearly seven&#160;million followers, and by August 2020 he had <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Facebook_pages" title="List of most-followed Facebook pages">over 101&#160;million followers</a>, the second highest for a sportsperson after Cristiano Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-515" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-515">&#91;510&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-516" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-516">&#91;511&#93;</a></sup> He has <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts" title="List of most-followed Instagram accounts">over 175&#160;million Instagram followers</a>, the second highest for a sportsperson after Cristiano Ronaldo.<sup id="cite_ref-517" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-517">&#91;512&#93;</a></sup> According to a 2014 survey by sports research firm Repucom in 15 international markets, Messi was familiar to 87% of respondents around the world, of whom 78% perceived him favourably, making him the second-most recognised player globally, behind Ronaldo, and the most likable of all contemporary players.<sup id="cite_ref-518" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-518">&#91;513&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-519" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-519">&#91;514&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Other events have illustrated Messi's presence in popular culture. A solid gold replica of his left foot, weighing 25&#160;kg (55&#160;lb) and valued at $5.25&#160;million, went on sale in Japan in March 2013 to raise funds for victims of the <a href="/wiki/2011_T%C5%8Dhoku_earthquake_and_tsunami" title="2011 Thoku earthquake and tsunami">2011 Thoku earthquake and tsunami</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-520" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-520">&#91;515&#93;</a></sup> A 2013 Turkish Airlines advertisement starring Messi, in which he engages in a <a href="/wiki/Selfie" title="Selfie">selfie</a> competition with then-<a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_Lakers" title="Los Angeles Lakers">Los Angeles Lakers</a> star <a href="/wiki/Kobe_Bryant" title="Kobe Bryant">Kobe Bryant</a>, was the most-watched ad on YouTube in the year of its release, receiving 137&#160;million views, and was subsequently voted the best advertisement of the 2005–15 decade to commemorate YouTube's founding.<sup id="cite_ref-521" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-521">&#91;516&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-522" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-522">&#91;517&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/World_Press_Photo" title="World Press Photo">World Press Photo</a> selected "The Final Game", a photograph of Messi facing the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Trophy" title="FIFA World Cup Trophy">World Cup trophy</a> after Argentina's final defeat to Germany, as the best sports image of 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-523" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-523">&#91;518&#93;</a></sup> <i><a href="/wiki/Messi_(2014_film)" title="Messi (2014 film)">Messi</a></i>, a documentary about his life by filmmaker <a href="/wiki/%C3%81lex_de_la_Iglesia" title="Álex de la Iglesia">Álex de la Iglesia</a>, premiered at the <a href="/wiki/Venice_Film_Festival" title="Venice Film Festival">Venice Film Festival</a> in August 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-524" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-524">&#91;519&#93;</a></sup> Born in a zoo at <a href="/wiki/Saransk" title="Saransk">Saransk</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mordovia" title="Mordovia">Mordovia</a>, Russia in late 2015, <a href="/wiki/Messi_(cougar)" title="Messi (cougar)">Messi</a>, a pet <a href="/wiki/Cougar" title="Cougar">cougar</a> who became popular on social media, was named after the player.<sup id="cite_ref-525" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-525">&#91;520&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Family_and_relationships">Family and relationships</span></h3>
<p>Since 2008, Messi has been in a relationship with Antonella Roccuzzo, a fellow native of <a href="/wiki/Rosario,_Santa_Fe" title="Rosario, Santa Fe">Rosario</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-526" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-526">&#91;521&#93;</a></sup> He has known Roccuzzo since he was five years old, as she is the cousin of his best friend since childhood, <a href="/wiki/Lucas_Scaglia" title="Lucas Scaglia">Lucas Scaglia</a>, who is also a football player.<sup id="cite_ref-527" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-527">&#91;522&#93;</a></sup> After keeping their relationship private for a year, Messi first confirmed their romance in an interview in January 2009, before going public a month later during a carnival in <a href="/wiki/Sitges" title="Sitges">Sitges</a> after the Barcelona–Espanyol derby.
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:30%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"Leo is not shy. He's introverted. He's reserved."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">– Endocrinologist Dr. Diego Schwarzstein addressed Messi's growth hormone deficiency from 1997 to 2001. According to <a href="/wiki/Bleacher_Report" title="Bleacher Report">Bleacher Report</a>'s Richard Fitzpatrick, "Schwarzstein and Messi built up a close relationship during more than four years of treatment."<sup id="cite_ref-BR_528-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BR-528">&#91;523&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Messi and Roccuzzo have three sons: Thiago (born 2012), Mateo (born 2015) and Ciro (born 2018). To celebrate his partner's first pregnancy, Messi placed the ball under his shirt after scoring in Argentina's 4–0 win against Ecuador on 2 June 2012, before confirming the pregnancy in an interview two weeks later.<sup id="cite_ref-529" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-529">&#91;524&#93;</a></sup> Thiago was born in Barcelona on 2 November 2012, with Messi attending the birth after being given permission by Barcelona to miss training. He announced his son's arrival on his Facebook page, writing, "Today I am the happiest man in the world, my son was born and thanks to God for this gift!"<sup id="cite_ref-530" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-530">&#91;525&#93;</a></sup> Thiago's name and handprints are tattooed on his left calf.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTECaioli2015ch._38_156-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTECaioli2015ch._38-156">&#91;152&#93;</a></sup> In April 2015, Messi confirmed on Facebook that they were expecting another child.<sup id="cite_ref-531" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-531">&#91;526&#93;</a></sup> He missed training ahead of a match against Atlético Madrid to attend the birth of his second son, Mateo, on 11 September 2015 in Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-532" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-532">&#91;527&#93;</a></sup> On 30 June 2017, he married Roccuzzo at a luxury hotel named Hotel City Center in Rosario with about 260 guests attending his wedding.<sup id="cite_ref-533" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-533">&#91;528&#93;</a></sup> On 15 October 2017, his wife announced they were expecting their third child in an <a href="/wiki/Instagram" title="Instagram">Instagram</a> post, with the words "Family of 5".<sup id="cite_ref-534" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-534">&#91;529&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-535" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-535">&#91;530&#93;</a></sup> On 10 March 2018, Messi skipped the match against Málaga after Ciro was born.<sup id="cite_ref-536" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-536">&#91;531&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Messi enjoys a close relationship with his immediate family members, particularly his mother, Celia, whose face he has tattooed on his left shoulder. His professional affairs are largely run as a family business: his father, Jorge, has been his agent since he was 14, and his oldest brother, Rodrigo, handles his daily schedule and publicity. His mother and other brother, Matías, manage his charitable organisation, the Leo Messi Foundation, and take care of personal and professional matters in Rosario.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201331,_143,_570_537-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué201331,_143,_570-537">&#91;532&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Since leaving for Spain at age 13, Messi has maintained close ties to his hometown of Rosario, even preserving his distinct Rosarino accent. He has kept ownership of his family's old house, although it has long stood empty; he maintains a penthouse apartment in an exclusive residential building for his mother, as well as a family compound just outside the city. Once when he was in training with the national team in Buenos Aires, he made a three-hour trip by car to Rosario immediately after practice to have dinner with his family, spent the night with them, and returned to Buenos Aires the next day in time for practice. Messi keeps in daily contact via phone and text with a small group of confidants in Rosario, most of whom were fellow members of "The Machine of '87" at Newell's Old Boys. He currently lives in <a href="/wiki/Castelldefels" title="Castelldefels">Castelldefels</a>, a village near Barcelona. Although considered a <a href="/wiki/List_of_one-club_men_in_association_football" title="List of one-club men in association football">one-club man</a>, he has long planned to return to Rosario to end his playing career at Newell's. He was on bad terms with the club after his transfer to Barcelona, but by 2012 their public feud had ended, with Newell's embracing their ties with Messi, even issuing a club membership card to his newborn son.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_538-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577-538">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-539" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-539">&#91;534&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>According to a genealogical research conducted by <a href="/wiki/Diari_Segre" title="Diari Segre">Diari Segre</a> in 2011, Messi is a fourth cousin of former teammate <a href="/wiki/Bojan_Krki%C4%87" title="Bojan Krki">Bojan Krki</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-540" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-540">&#91;535&#93;</a></sup> The finding had a very significant coverage in Spanish media: it was reported by all four major sports newspapers<sup id="cite_ref-541" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-541">&#91;536&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-542" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-542">&#91;537&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-543" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-543">&#91;538&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-544" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-544">&#91;539&#93;</a></sup> and by some of the largest general-interest newspapers, including <i><a href="/wiki/ABC_(newspaper)" title="ABC (newspaper)">ABC</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/La_Vanguardia" title="La Vanguardia">La Vanguardia</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-545" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-545">&#91;540&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-546" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-546">&#91;541&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-547" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-547">&#91;542&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Philanthropy">Philanthropy</span></h3>
<p>Throughout his career, Messi has been involved in charitable efforts aimed at vulnerable children, a commitment that stems in part from the medical difficulties he faced in his own childhood. Since 2004, he has contributed his time and finances to the <a href="/wiki/UNICEF" title="UNICEF">United Nations Children's Fund</a> (UNICEF), an organisation with which Barcelona also have a strong association.<sup id="cite_ref-Leo_Messi:_Goodwill_Ambassador_548-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Leo_Messi:_Goodwill_Ambassador-548">&#91;543&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-549" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-549">&#91;544&#93;</a></sup> Messi has served as a <a href="/wiki/List_of_UNICEF_Goodwill_Ambassadors" title="List of UNICEF Goodwill Ambassadors">UNICEF goodwill ambassador</a> since his appointment in March 2010, completing his first field mission for the organisation four months later as he travelled to Haiti to bring public awareness to the plight of the country's children in the wake of the <a href="/wiki/2010_Haiti_earthquake" title="2010 Haiti earthquake">recent earthquake</a>. He has since participated in UNICEF campaigns targeting HIV prevention, education, and the social inclusion of disabled children.<sup id="cite_ref-550" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-550">&#91;545&#93;</a></sup> To celebrate his son's first birthday, in November 2013, Messi and Thiago were part of a publicity campaign to raise awareness of mortality rates among disadvantaged children.<sup id="cite_ref-551" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-551">&#91;546&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014,_3_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="227" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014%2C_3_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="444" data-file-height="592" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Cristina_Fern%C3%A1ndez_y_la_Selecci%C3%B3n_Argentina_de_f%C3%BAtbol_2014,_3_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi pictured in July 2014</div></div></div>
<p>In addition to his work with UNICEF, Messi founded his own charitable organisation, the Leo Messi Foundation, which supports access to health care, education, and sport for children.<sup id="cite_ref-552" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-552">&#91;547&#93;</a></sup> It was established in 2007 following a visit Messi paid to a hospital for terminally ill children in Boston, an experience that resonated with him to the point that he decided to reinvest part of his earnings into society.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_538-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577-538">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup> Through his foundation, Messi has awarded research grants, financed medical training, and invested in the development of medical centres and projects in Argentina, Spain, and elsewhere in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_538-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577-538">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-553" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-553">&#91;548&#93;</a></sup> In addition to his own fundraising activities, such as his global "Messi and Friends" football matches, his foundation receives financial support from various companies to which he has assigned his name in endorsement agreements, with Adidas as their main sponsor.<sup id="cite_ref-&#39;Lionel_Messi_and_Friends&#39;_Soccer_Tour_Is_One_of_Many_Causes_Argentine_Superstar_Supports_554-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-&#39;Lionel_Messi_and_Friends&#39;_Soccer_Tour_Is_One_of_Many_Causes_Argentine_Superstar_Supports-554">&#91;549&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-555" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-555">&#91;550&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Messi has also invested in youth football in Argentina: he financially supports Sarmiento, a football club based in the Rosario neighbourhood where he was born, committing in 2013 to the refurbishment of their facilities and the installation of all-weather pitches, and funds the management of several youth players at Newell's Old Boys and rival club <a href="/wiki/Rosario_Central" title="Rosario Central">Rosario Central</a>, as well as at <a href="/wiki/Club_Atl%C3%A9tico_River_Plate" title="Club Atlético River Plate">River Plate</a> and <a href="/wiki/Boca_Juniors" title="Boca Juniors">Boca Juniors</a> in Buenos Aires.<sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577_538-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué2013576–577-538">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup> At Newell's Old Boys, his boyhood club, he funded the 2012 construction of a new gymnasium and a dormitory inside the club's <a href="/wiki/Estadio_Marcelo_Bielsa" title="Estadio Marcelo Bielsa">stadium</a> for their youth academy. His former youth coach at Newell's, Ernesto Vecchio, is employed by the Leo Messi Foundation as a talent scout for young players.<sup id="cite_ref-Here_and_Gone_22-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Here_and_Gone-22">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup> On 7 June 2016, Messi won a libel case against <a href="/wiki/La_Raz%C3%B3n_(Madrid)" title="La Razón (Madrid)"><i>La Razón</i> newspaper</a> and was awarded €65,000 in damages, which he donated to the charity <a href="/wiki/M%C3%A9decins_Sans_Fronti%C3%A8res" title="Médecins Sans Frontières">Médecins Sans Frontières</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-556" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-556">&#91;551&#93;</a></sup> Messi made a donation worth €1&#160;million ($1.1&#160;million) to fight the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">spread of coronavirus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-557" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-557">&#91;552&#93;</a></sup> This was split between Clinic Barcelona hospital in <a href="/wiki/Barcelona,_Spain" class="mw-redirect" title="Barcelona, Spain">Barcelona, Spain</a> and his native Argentina.<sup id="cite_ref-558" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-558">&#91;553&#93;</a></sup> In addition to this, Messi along with his fellow <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> teammates announced he will be taking a 70% cut in salaries during the coronavirus emergency, and contribute further to the club to provide fully to salaries of all the clubs employees.<sup id="cite_ref-559" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-559">&#91;554&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In November 2016, with the <a href="/wiki/Argentine_Football_Association" title="Argentine Football Association">Argentine Football Association</a> being run by a FIFA committee for emergency due to an economic crisis, it was reported that three of the national team's security staff told Messi that they had not received their salaries for six months. He stepped in and paid the salaries of the three members.<sup id="cite_ref-560" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-560">&#91;555&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-561" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-561">&#91;556&#93;</a></sup> In February 2021, Messi donated his Adidas shoes to the <a href="/wiki/Museu_Nacional_d%27Art_de_Catalunya" title="Museu Nacional d&#39;Art de Catalunya">Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya</a> which he wore when he scored his 644th goal for Barcelona and broke Pelé's record for most goals scored for a single club, with the shoes being later auctioned off in April by the museum for charity to help children with cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-562" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-562">&#91;557&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Tax_fraud">Tax fraud</span></h3>
<p>Messi's financial affairs came under investigation in 2013 for suspected <a href="/wiki/Tax_evasion" title="Tax evasion">tax evasion</a>. Offshore companies in <a href="/wiki/Tax_haven" title="Tax haven">tax havens</a> Uruguay and Belize were used to evade €4.1&#160;million in taxes related to sponsorship earnings between 2007 and 2009. An unrelated <a href="/wiki/Shell_company" class="mw-redirect" title="Shell company">shell company</a> in Panama set up in 2012 was subsequently identified as belonging to the Messis in the <a href="/wiki/Panama_Papers" title="Panama Papers">Panama Papers</a> data leak. Messi, who pleaded ignorance of the alleged scheme, voluntarily paid arrears of €5.1&#160;million in August 2013. On 6 July 2016, Messi and his father were both found guilty of tax fraud and were handed <a href="/wiki/Suspended_sentence" title="Suspended sentence">suspended</a> 21-month prison sentences and respectively ordered to pay €1.7&#160;million and €1.4&#160;million in fines.<sup id="cite_ref-563" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-563">&#91;558&#93;</a></sup> Facing the judge, he said, "I just played football. I signed the contracts because I trusted my dad and the lawyers and we had decided that they would take charge of those things."<sup id="cite_ref-564" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-564">&#91;559&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

<li id="cite_note-566"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-566">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">One appearance in <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Super_Cup" title="UEFA Super Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a>, two appearances in <a href="/wiki/Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-567"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-567">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">One appearance in UEFA Super Cup, one appearance and two goals in Supercopa de España, two appearances and two goals in <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-SDE-568"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-SDE_568-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Appearance(s) in Supercopa de España</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-569"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-569">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">One appearance and one goal in UEFA Super Cup, two appearances and three goals in Supercopa de España, two appearances and two goals in FIFA Club World Cup</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-572"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-572">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">One appearance and two goals in UEFA Super Cup, two appearances and one goal in Supercopa de España, one appearance and one goal in FIFA Club World Cup</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_2">Club</span></h3>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a>: <a href="/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_La_Liga" title="2004–05 La Liga">2004–05</a>, <a href="/wiki/2005%E2%80%9306_La_Liga" title="2005–06 La Liga">2005–06</a>, <a href="/wiki/2008%E2%80%9309_La_Liga" title="2008–09 La Liga">2008–09</a>, <a href="/wiki/2009%E2%80%9310_La_Liga" title="2009–10 La Liga">2009–10</a>, <a href="/wiki/2010%E2%80%9311_La_Liga" title="2010–11 La Liga">2010–11</a>, <a href="/wiki/2012%E2%80%9313_La_Liga" title="2012–13 La Liga">2012–13</a>, <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_La_Liga" title="2014–15 La Liga">2014–15</a>, <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_La_Liga" title="2015–16 La Liga">2015–16</a>, <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_La_Liga" title="2017–18 La Liga">2017–18</a>, <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_La_Liga" title="2018–19 La Liga">2018–19</a></li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Individual">Individual</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:202px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/200px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="190" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/300px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/400px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3411" data-file-height="3241" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Messi (left) with the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Club_World_Cup_awards#Golden_Ball" title="FIFA Club World Cup awards">Golden Ball award</a>, shaking hands with future teammate <a href="/wiki/Neymar" title="Neymar">Neymar</a> (Bronze Ball winner) after the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_Final" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final">2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final</a>.</div></div></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734"/><div class="reflist reflist-upper-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In isolation, <i>Andrés</i> is pronounced <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Spanish" title="Help:IPA/Spanish">[andes]</a></span>. <i>Cuccittini</i> is pronounced <small></small><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Italian" title="Help:IPA/Italian">[kut.tittini]</a></span> in Italian.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734"/><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-8">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">According to his club's official website, FCBarcelona.com, and his authorised biography, <i>Messi</i> by <a href="/wiki/Guillem_Balagu%C3%A9" title="Guillem Balagué">Guillem Balagué</a>, his surname is the single "Messi", in accordance with Argentine customs.<sup id="cite_ref-Profile:_Lionel_Andrés_Messi_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Profile:_Lionel_Andrés_Messi-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBalagué201332–37_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBalagué201332–37-5">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup> Other sources, including a 2014 document by <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a>, give his surname as the double "Messi Cuccittini".<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup> After winning a libel case in 2017, Messi's own management company stated: "The football player Lionel Andres Messi Cuccittini has donated a total of €72,783.20 to the organisation <a href="/wiki/Doctors_Without_Borders" class="mw-redirect" title="Doctors Without Borders">Doctors Without Borders</a>."<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-12">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In addition to four FIFA Ballons d'Or, Messi received <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i><span class="nowrap" style="padding-left:0.1em;">&#39;</span>s <a href="/wiki/Ballon_d%27Or" title="Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a> and <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a>'s <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Player_of_the_Year" title="FIFA World Player of the Year">World Player of the Year award</a> in 2009 prior to their incorporation; both organisations credited him with five (FIFA) Ballons d'Or.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup> In 2019 he received a sixth <a href="/wiki/2019_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2019 Ballon d&#39;Or">Ballon d'Or</a>, as well as winning the <a href="/wiki/The_Best_FIFA_Men%27s_Player" title="The Best FIFA Men&#39;s Player">Best FIFA Men's Player</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Assist_statistics-186"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Assist_statistics_186-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Assist statistics began in 1990.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-greek">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-U23-4"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-U23_4-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-U23_4-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Does not include an appearance for Argentina U23 against the <a href="/wiki/Catalonia_national_football_team" title="Catalonia national football team">unofficial Catalonia team</a> in May 2008.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-Career_billion-15"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Career_billion_15-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Career_billion_15-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/christinasettimi/2020/09/14/the-worlds-highest-paid-soccer-players-2020-messi-wins-mbappe-rises/#7601f0671cff">"World's Highest-Paid Soccer Players: Messi Wins, Mbappe Rises"</a>. <i>Forbes</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-The_New_Messiah-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-The_New_Messiah_35-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-The_New_Messiah_35-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/clubworldcup/japan2006/news/newsid=103182/index.html">"The New Messiah"</a>. <li id="cite_note-56"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-56">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite id="CITEREFLowe2017" class="citation news cs1">Lowe, Sid (16 June 2017). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/16/joan-laporta-barcelona-board-resign-pep-guardiola-lionel-messi">"Joan Laporta: 'Barcelona has been kidnapped. <li id="cite_note-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands-321"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands_321-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Magic_Messi_Sparks_High_Drama_in_the_Lowlands_321-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/news/y=2007/m=3/news=magic-messi-sparks-high-drama-the-lowlands-501784.html">"Magic Messi Sparks High Drama in the Lowlands"</a>. <li id="cite_note-Telegraph_2016-467"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Telegraph_2016_467-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/06/11/magical-messi-grabs-hat-trick-in-copa-america-as-argentina-romp/">"Magical Messi Grabs Hat-trick in Copa America as Argentina Romp into Quarters"</a>. <i>The Daily Telegraph</i>. Agence France-Presse. 11 June 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 June</span> 2016</span>. <q>Widely regarded as the best footballer of all time, Lionel Messi ... has sublime balance and is able to dribble past defenders with almost inhuman ease.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Daily+Telegraph&amp;rft.atitle=Magical+Messi+Grabs+Hat-trick+in+Copa+America+as+Argentina+Romp+into+Quarters&amp;rft.date=2016-06-11&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.telegraph.co.uk%2Ffootball%2F2016%2F06%2F11%2Fmagical-messi-grabs-hat-trick-in-copa-america-as-argentina-romp%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALionel+Messi" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-642"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-642">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.france24.com/fr/20111224-lionel-messi-sacre-champion-equipe-argentin-barcelone-football-sport-leo-barca">"Lionel Messi sacré "Champion des champions" de l'année 2011"</a>. <i>France 24</i> (in French). 24 December 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">7 June</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=France+24&amp;rft.atitle=Lionel+Messi+sacr%C3%A9+%22Champion+des+champions%22+de+l%27ann%C3%A9e+2011&amp;rft.date=2011-12-24&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.france24.com%2Ffr%2F20111224-lionel-messi-sacre-champion-equipe-argentin-barcelone-football-sport-leo-barca&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALionel+Messi" class="Z3988"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-643"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-643">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.lorientlejour.com/article/737802/Lionel_Messi_elu_%253C%253C%2Bchampion_des_champions_2011%2B%253E%253E_par_le_journal_%253C%253C%2BL%2527Equipe%2B%253E%253E.html">"Lionel Messi élu " champion des champions 2011 " par le journal " L'Équipe <span class="cs1-kern-right">"</span>"</a>. <i>L'Orient-Le Jour</i>. 27 December 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">.
